While the top is spinning the player will drop the six colored wooden balls through the hole in the platform so that they may roll down the sides of the platform and strike the spinning top. The balls will bounce off the top in a lively manner and will fall into holes thus scoring.

If the top jumps out of the center the SCORE DOES NOT COUNT. The player loses his opportunity to score during that play. Try to spin the top so as to keep it spinning, and keep it in the center circle. A grand total score of 3000 points wins.

146587.description:
Promo Set #2 includes extended, full-art, English versions of the following maids:

Claudine De La Rochelle (PR06)
Aline Du Roy (PR07)
Clymene Silvestri (PR08)
Shion Tsuwabuki (PR09)
Eve Valentine (PR10)

The set has been distributed with purchases of Tanto Cuore: Expanding the House.
146587.name: Tanto Cuore: Promo Card Set #2

146588.name: Family, The Game
146588.description: Family members, or at least friends who know each other well, take turns answering questions from a booklet while the remaining players attempt to correctly predict their answers. Correct guesses allow your pawn to advance towards the goal.

146589.name: The Artifact (Project)
146589.description:
The Artifact is a game for 2-5 players where betraying your friends and stealing from them is as important as discovering resources and exploring the cosmos.

The Artifact uses an innovative map dynamic which means every game is unique and different.
Set in the far-future and featuring startling artwork, over 100 cards, exotic locations and constantly evolving play, The Artifact is a game like no other.
Win by strategy, tactics or blind luck!

Players can choose from 8 different factions, each with their own ideology, abilities and agenda.
Everyone starts from Earth and plays location cards to build the game board and open exploration. This gets larger and more expansive every turn!
Moving around the universe, players attempt to capture Artifact Markers from different locations such as planets, derelict ships, spaceports, even Alien colonies! All the while hamstringing other players!
Using events, items, special abilities and fuel, players can fight, steal, strand or even send players in the wrong direction, all to achieve the ultimate goal; gain 4 Artifact Markers and begin the Race for the Artifact!

146590.name: La Piste
146590.description:
Designed by a fencing instructor, La Piste is a fast paced, 2-player fencing simulation card game. Each player selects a fencer with special skills and a weapon (foil, epee, or saber). Fencers move along a strip and play a variety of cards representing various fencing moves. A six-sided die determines certain outcomes.

This game focuses on fencing moves and tries to capture the strategy and speed of real fencing.

Extra parts needed to play:

1 6-sided die
2 tokens to track score

146591.name: The Bermuda Race
146591.description:
User Summary

Sail an 80ft racing sailboat from Newport, Rhode Island to Bermuda in this simulation. Position your centerboard, Determine your heading and set sail as you try to beat the (1982) course record of 62:29 hours.

146592.name: Crootle: A Card Game of Kaleidoscopic Proportions
146592.description:
Crootle is an abstract game that entails matching colors. There are 112 Color Tiles in a standard deck, along with 20 Corner Tiles. Each tile in the deck is 1.375" square. Crootle uses four colors, red, green, blue, and yellow. Each Color tile is divided into quadrants, each quadrant one of the four colors. A Color Tile may have each of its quadrants a different color, or they may be all the same, or a combination. Because there are four colors, there are 256 color combinations possible, 112 of which have been selected to make this standard deck. A Corner Tile is the same size but is solid in color. A set of Corner Tiles consists of one of each of the four colors in Crootle.

The object of the game of Crootle is to connect two corners of the playing field together. Each game the Corner Tiles are randomly set, and each player randomly selects their path, or rather their two corners to connect. Four players could feasibly be on the same path as each other.

Through timed turn play, each player draws Color Tiles and matches them side to side, trying to connect, or block their opponents from connecting, their two corners.

Fun for anyone who sits down to play. Playing head to head with players of equal ability can prove to make a challenging game. Test playing has found audiences in children 7+, adult party games, senior players, and even some autistic and other mentally challenged persons have enjoyed the task of connecting Color Tiles.

146594.name: Wrath of the Autarch
146594.description:
Publisher Info

Wrath of the Autarch is a tabletop kingdom building game. The players create a society over the course of the campaign, called the Stronghold. One player controls the schemes of the Autarch, the ruler of an empire which opposes the Stronghold. The other players control important leaders and heroes from the Stronghold. The campaign ends when either the Autarch is stopped or the Stronghold falls.

The Stronghold players must use their land and resources wisely, prioritizing their activities each season in an attempt to thwart the Autarch. Wrath of the Autarch features troupe style play, 4X domain management, a special challenge system that lets all the players add to the narrative, and four types of minigames (diplomacy, infiltration, skirmish, and warfare) to handle the various missions the Stronghold players undertake.

Will you build up a military force to stop the Autarch? Use diplomacy and convince the scattered factions around you to unite for a common cause? Go on perilous quests for legendary artifacts? Or ignore the great risks, and harness the power of the arcane arts? How much will you sacrifice for your independence?

146595.name: WarFields
146595.description:
WarFields is a two player fantasy card game of warriors, summoners, beasts and undead. You'll build an army of the unique characters and progress across fields to meet your opponent head on. Break down your opponent's army and take down your opponent’s king before he takes out yours.

Each turn has four stages: Currency Stage, Build Stage, Move Stage, and Attack Stage. During the Currency Stage, you collect gold from workers and selling cards. Gold drives the game and is use throughout each turn. During the Build Stage, you use gold to add characters to your army or use powerful scrolls. During the Move Stage, you may choose to move your army closer to your opponent or farther away. Lastly during the Attack Stage, you attack you opponent's army with your unique army.

The goal of the game is to break through your opponent's army and take out their King. The first player to take out the opponent's King is the winner.

146596.name: Logo Party
146596.description:
Official Game Description:

It's not what you know that counts, it's what you do! Get your teammates to guess brands based on four different types of clues:

Draw It!: Draw clues about the brand, without writing words, letters, or numbers.

Describe It!: Say what you want, but don't say the brand. Hurry, the clock's ticking!

Do It!: Act out the brand. No talking allowed!

Reveal It: Both teams watch as a logo is slowly revealed. Be the first to shout out the brand!

146597.description:
Players are fishmongers whose supply comes exclusively from the world's most contaminated body of water: Lake Miasma. Every single thing that comes out of that cesspool has SOMETHING wrong with it. How do you make a profit out of this thing?

Discount Salmon is NOT a trick taking game (but claims to be) in which players simultaneously try to resolve fish quality issues or make it more difficult for other players to do the same by making bad fish even worse. Fish problems include Stinky, Dry, Poisonous, Ugly and Not a Fish. The conditions are resolved by Perfume, Lotion, Antidote, Make-Up and a Fish Costume respectively. If a fish does not already have a condition it can be added by playing Rotten Eggs, Blistering Hot Sun, Nuclear Waste, Mustache or Fish Decoy. As it's a speed game, all players are applying modifiers to the fish simultaneously. The player that resolves the last of it's remaining conditions wins the fish. The winning player is the one who has accumulated the most fish when all the fish cards have been resolved.
146597.name: Discount Salmon
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 29 - GenCon 2016 Two-Player Preview

146598.name: Pentominoes
146598.description:
A pentomino is a five-square puzzle piece. If you took five squares, and laid them against each other, edge to edge, then that would be a pentomino. There are exactly twelve different ways you can arrange five squares. In the original puzzle, the task was to create interesting patterns using the pieces.

Pentominoes is played on a 10" x 10" board ruled into 100 squares. (Solomon W. Golomb's original design for a pentomino game featured an 8x8 grid of 64 squares.) Each player has one set of Pentominoes and these are placed anywhere on the board in turn. The object of the game is not to make patterns but to place pentominoes on the board in such a way that the last player cannot place a shape on the board.

Limits to placement:
1. A vacant space of at least five squares must be left after placing a piece on the board.
2. The winning player may place some of his remaining pieces in the vacant spaces to score double points for one and triple points for two.

The rules add a tip: It is advisable to try to reserve a space in the shape of one of your pieces after your opponent has played that shape.

146599.name: Emperor (TRS-80)
146599.description:
Catalog Description

Try Running the Roman Empire

EMPEROR is entirely a game of strategy, played on a graphic map of the Roman Empire as it as in the first four centuries A.D. The player takes the part of the Emperor and he must pit his wits and forces against invading barbarians, rebellious provincials and treacherous Roman Generals. Even the Plebs of Rome will have to be placated with bread and circuses if the Emperor is to keep his head and his throne. If he can last out the first eight years of the game, he is judged on the state of the Empire at the end of that time. There are three levels of play. Depending upon his choice, the Emperor has to guide the Empire through three centuries with each century reflecting a different set of historical circumstances. During play Legions must be raised, taxes inflicted and troops moved. The choice of Generals can be critical - some are loyal and good fighters, some are neither. Battles must be fought and invasions repelled. All the while the citizens in Rome must be kept happy and - you must keep an eye on those Barbarians in outer Britannia.

146601.name: King Arthur (TRS-80)
146601.description:
Catalog Description

A Short Historical Simulation

This program is written by Dr Bodley-Scott, the author of EMPEROR and HANNIBAL. Dr Scott has now moved on in history somewhat and his present program is concerned with the reign of King Arthur who probably lived in the late fifth or sixth century A.D. In addition to changing his period, Dr Scott has also written KING ARTHUR so that, unlike the previous programs it can be completed in a comparatively short sitting. Normally it will take between twenty minutes and half an hour to play a game. As with EMPEROR and HANNIBAL, a map is displayed on the screen. In this case, of course, it shows Britain as it was at the beginning of the sixth century A.D. Also on the screen and to the right of the map is a status report listing the provinces currently under British control, together with their strategic strengths. Spies can be sent out to scout enemy territory and each year the War-Host musters at a place of the High King's choice. Contingents are sent out from the British Kingdoms, but in the Winter the men of the War-Host disperse to their homes. There are two campaigning moves each year, Spring and Autumn, and battle takes place after each campaigning move, whenever Britons meet Anglo-Saxons in the same province. In early spring of each year Anglo-Saxon reinforcements arrive, but ravaging the Anglo-Saxon lands will discourage such reinforcements. The ultimate aim of the game is to prevent further encroachment on British Territory by the Anglo-Saxons. The game covers a period of 10 years and the players' performance is assessed at the end of that time.

146602.name: Arcane Duels
146602.description:
In Arcane Duels the players are wizards fighting each other using their spells while at the same time they try to complete an arcane ritual.

Each player has 2 actions per turn to gather energy, cast spells and complete one part of the ritual, then the next player takes his turn. The game goes on until all but one wizards are eliminated from the game (by reducing their hitpoints to zero) or until one ritual has been completed (in this case the player who contributed the most to all the rituals in play wins the game).

The catch of this game is that each wizard with all his abilities and spells is represented by a single card which will be rotated after each time that wizards has used a spell, giving him/her new options for his next action(s).

146603.name: Doctor Who: Facts & Trivia Quiz Game
146603.description:
Amazing spinning TARDIS answer mechanism!

The Doctor is terribly clever and quick-witted - he always seems to know the correct answers, so how much do you know about Doctor Who facts and trivia? Think you can beat him?

In this fun facts and trivia question and answer quiz game, test you and your friends' knowledge about Doctor Who and learn all about this excited TV show. Turn and point the TARDIS to a question and as if by magic it will spin around and show you the correct answer.

146604.name: Alien Assemblage
146604.description:
In this upcoming card game based on the old dice game Beetle, you draw and play cards and hope to create an entire alien before something horrible happens.

Players have a hand of 5 cards from a deck of 108 that contains body parts, as well as actions. Draw a card from the deck, then play a card.

You can add a body part to your alien - you need to collect a body, a head, two antenna, two arms, two wings, two legs and a tail - or you can play a card that affects an opponent by stealing one of their body parts or one of their cards.

Watch out for the red cards - these must be played immediately and could wipe out your hand. And there's one card in the deck that destroys your entire alien!

146605.name: Ooh! Grootmoeder
146605.description:
Red riding hood is going to grandmother's house with all kinds of treats. But in Grandmother's bed the big bad wolf is waiting for her.

The game board consists of 4 puzzle pieces and a 3D-bed in which grandmother lays. In the beginning of the game a mask has to be put on grandmother, so she becomes the wolf. Red riding hood is being placed on a small rotating disc at the end of the bed.

All players have to take three treats to grandmother. Every turn a player has to move one pawn according to the number of pips on the die. If the turn ends on a stone, the next player takes a turn. If the turn ends in grandmother's house, the player turns red riding hood. If the wolf stays asleep in bed, the player takes his pawn and lays it in front of him. He then continues play with his second pawn. If the wolf wakes up the player has to start over with that pawn. The first player who places his third pawn in front of him, wins the game.

146606.description:
A fox-and-rabbit themed press-your-luck game for children.

Theme
Roger Rabbit and his friends are having a picnic at the park, but in order to participate, everyone has to bring a carrot. But Frido the fox knows about the picnic too and he's lying in wait! As soon as the alarm call sounds, all the rabbits run off. Will you be the one who is best at calculating the fox risk and manages to collect four rabbits and four carrots on your picnic blanket first?

Goal
Collect four rabbit and four carrot tiles to earn a candy token. Earn two candy tokens to win the game.

Game play
The tiles (16 rabbits, 19 carrots, 7 foxes) are put in the tile bag. 3 tiles are removed from the game, without anyone knowing what they are (there is a variant with no tiles being removed). Each player gets a board showing a picnic blanket with designated spaces for four rabbits and four carrots. Players take turns. On your turn, you draw a tile from the bag.
If it is a carrot or rabbit, place it next to your board. Then you may keep drawing tiles as long as they show either a carrot or rabbit. You can stop drawing tiles at any point. When you decided to stop, you first place the carrots on your board. For each carrot, you may also place a rabbit. Tiles for which you don't have enough space on your board, or rabbits for which there are no carrots, go back to the bag.
If you draw a fox, the rabbits flee and you have to put all the rabbits and carrots drawn during this turn back into the bag. The fox tile is put into the fox den (i.e. it doesn't go back to the bag). Then the next player's turn starts.

The round ends when a player has collected four carrots and four rabbits on his/her board. The player gets a candy token. All carrots, rabbits and foxes are returned to the bag and a new round starts.
The game ends when a player has collected two candy tokens. He/she wins the game.
146606.name: Vorsicht, Fuchs!

146607.name: Ascension: Rise of Vigil – Ethereal Huntress Promo
146607.description:
Promo that comes with the Ascension Collector's Box.

5 runes to acquire.

Gain 3 fight. You may put a Monster from the Void on top of the center deck.

Worth 3 points.

146608.name: Harrier Attack II
146608.description:
User Summary

Returning to gaming after nearly two decades, Durell presents Harrier Attack II, a 3D side-scrolling shooter. You control your Harrier jet over a series of missions. Your ultimate goal is to regain control of your islands which have been lost to the enemy. As you fight, gather new weapons, equipment as well as a second harrier plane. It is also imperative that you hone in on special skills. You will need them all in the struggle over the final island.

146609.name: Tar Heel Basketball Trivia
146609.description: A variant of Trivial Pursuit where the questions are exclusively about the UNC Chapel Hill basketball team, during the Dean Smith era. Instead of collecting pie wedges, you collect rings, which you place around your Old Well playing piece. Categories are broken down by time period, general questions about UNC Basketball history, and questions about the coaching staff. Players win by collecting rings in all colors, and then moving to the picture of Dean Smith and answering one final question about the staff.

146610.name: WWII Battle Tanks: T-34 vs. Tiger
146610.description:
User Summary

Relive "Operation Bagration", the Russian great 1944 offensive to recapture Minsk. Whether you choose to be on the side of the Russians, controlling an accurately simulated T-34, or on the side of the Germans, controlling the legendary and deadly Tiger, you will engage in ferocious firefights in six exciting missions and get to blast enemy tanks and assorted troops to Kingdom Come.

There are three playable positions in each tank: Commander, Driver or Gunner. You can choose either one, leaving the rest to the AI, and can freely interchange among the three. Every position is important and switching at the right time to take personal control maybe be of crucial importance for the turn of events.

146611.name: Lost Empire: Immortals
146611.description:
From back of the box:

Take command of powerful fleets, to conquer and to explore the hidden knowledge of the universe. War is at hand, and from all the mysterious races, dark rumors can be heard. Will this be the final war, ending in destruction and chaos - or will this be a chance to rebuild that which was once forgotten?

146612.name: Kingdom Under Fire: A War of Heroes
146612.description:
Kingdom Under Fire is set in the fantasy land of Bersiah and covers the struggle between the forces of light (Humans, Dwarves, and Elves) and the forces of dark (Ogres, Orcs, Undead, and others.One hundred years before the events of the game, an epic war was waged between the two forces until finally a legendary group known as the Knights of Xok defeated the forces of dark and brought peace to the land of Bersiah.

Two factions, light and dark, are playable in the game, with each side having units fulfilling the typical roles of warrior, archer, flying unit and wizards – as well as more powerful individual hero characters. The campaigns are split into 13 missions of which 10 are battles and the other three being a dungeon crawl for a hero character.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kingdom Under Fire: A War of Heroes", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

146613.description:
From the publisher: The Mercenary's Handbook is a BattleTech and MechWarrior supplement describing the mercenary way of life. It details everything from troop capabilities to a mercenary unit's expenses, and from the ins and outs of contract negotiations to the nature of 31st century warfare. Commentary and views on the Succession Wars mercenary provide a solid background for gamers who need to learn the basics of the business of war, while game rules translate these ideas into simple systems for creating a merc outfit, finding and signing with employers, and resolving an entire military campaign.

This 104-page book contains more than 50 full-color illustrations and mercenary crests. The complete history and operating procedures of three example mercenary companies are also included, the Eridani Light Horse, the Waco Rangers, and Wilson's Hussars.
146613.name: BattleTech: Mercenary's Handbook

146614.name: Far Gate
videogamehonor: 2000 IGF Awards Audience Choice Winner
2000 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
146614.description:
Far Gate was released in September 2001 and was Super X Studios’s first game project. We built on existing conventions of the Real-Time Stretegy (RTS) genre, making the move to a full 3-dimensional battlefield. With unique ship designs and great visuals, Far Gate took home the 2000 Independent Games Festival Audience Award and subsequently saw a worldwide release.

Source: [ The Developer Website].

146615.description:
From the publisher: The Ronin Wars. The Andurien/Magistracy invasion of House Liao. The Anton Revolt and subsequent Marik Civil War. Against the empire spanning conflicts of the Fourth Succession War, Clan Invasion and FedCom Civil War, historians all too often forget such important conflicts, relegating them to the category of "low intensity warfare." Yet it is these very conflicts that tend to shape the internal politics and culture of each faction, often with more profound impact than the largest wars.

The Historical: Brush Wars campaign sourcebook details the actions involving every line unit in the most important "low level conflicts" of the early thirty-first century. Maps and full regiment listings convey additional details, while ample campaign rules provide a framework allowing players to replay detail of each war.
146615.name: Classic Battletech: Historical – Brush Wars
boardgameexpansion: BattleTech Field Manual: Free World's League

146617.name: Shogun Hex
146617.description:
Shogun Hex is a fast game inspired by board games: Reiner Knizia's Samurai and Dirk Henn's Shogun.

The aim of the game is to dominate the economy, military and religion in a feudal Japan. You gain points by influencing cities by placing strategical establishments. You can also use special elements that raise a cities value (nō theatre) or make it worthless (geisha) or even forbid other players to influense a city (peasants revolt).

You can play with AI or play multiplayer on one device. You can quickly learn how to play through tutorial or reading rules.

Source: The Developer Website.

146618.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Constantly searching for a technological edge on the battlefield, the Clans and the nations of the Inner Sphere have now taken to refitting proven, classic 'Mech designs with new technology to produce machines of awesome destructive power.

BattleTech: Record Sheets: Upgrades provides more than 170 filled-out record sheets for BattleMech, ProtoMech, and vehicle variants and configurations for the standard 'Mech designs presented in the Technical Readouts: 3050, 3055, 3058 and 3060.
146618.name: BattleTech: Record Sheets – Upgrades

146620.name: Tunse'al Setting Guide (Savage Worlds)
146620.description:
From the back of the book:

Honor is everything.
Money does not exist.
And the World Really is Out to get YOU!

Play in a world where technology is slow to advance, tribes are divided by great geographical expanses, magic is scarce, trade is fraught with peril, dinosuar-like beasts co-exist with people, and the very environment poses danger to your party.

Tunse'al is a tribal, fantasy setting with four playable races that are outside the norm. The swamp-dwelling Kresh are an amphibious, genderless race committed to ensuring their sacred land, The Wetlands, is safe from greedy destruction. The cold-enduring Gelid use their pathfinding ways throughout the long stretches of the Baarek Mountains to explore and make peace wherever possible. The towering, red-skinned, two-horned Korrin pursue all things with passion in their free-form society of The Footlands' jungles. The thick-skinned, nomadic Gales with eyes resembling a snake's wander The Drylands' sands in search of desert gems, tar, and other commodities no one else would have any hope obtaining.

The Skin Eaters of The Dreamlands round out the dominant races, although they are only at the GM's disposal. They are the treacherous, twisted cousins to the Kresh. In her madness, their creator, Sa'ra, made the Skin Eaters dependent upon others' skins in order to live. They are not mindless, but no tribe trusts them as historical attempts to have a respectable relationship have always ended in bloodshed.

In conjunction with a Savage Worlds rule book, this guide contains everything you need to explore the lands and people of Tunse'al.

146621.name: Gammon Challenger
146621.description:
Publisher's Catalog

The backgammon player featured in Personal Computing (August 1979) is now back in a faster, even better version! The game of logic of the new Gammon Challenger has been improved for extra speed, and there are more special features than ever.

Choose one of three levels of play, but don't get too ambitious--Gammon Challenger will put your skill to the test at all levels. For serious players, the "doubling cube" option can be used for added excitement. There are other computer backgammon games, but none quite like Gammon Challenger.

User Summary

Prior to being published by Acorn Software, Gammon Challenger was published as a type-in BASIC program listing in the August 1979 issue of Personal Computing magazine.

146622.description:
Discover the two new drivers for the urban race of Formula D. These crazy guys join the race.

Released on Asmodee's website are two brand new print & play drivers for Formula D. They can be downloaded at: http://us.asmodee.com/ressources/articles/formula-d-more-we-... (dead link!)

Boris Spoutnik

Tires 6

Brakes 3

Gearbox 3

Car body 3

Engine 2

Road handling 3

Special: Aspiration Pro

Once per lap, Boris Spoutnik can move 5 spaces when doing an aspiration.

Pipo Rapido

Tires 7

Brakes 2

Gearbox 3

Car body 3

Engine 3

Road handling 3


Special: Fast Starter
Pipo Rapido has a Great Start on a result of 11 to 20 and on a 1 he has a normal start.
146622.name: Formula D: More We Are Driver Expansion

146623.name: Basketball (Acorn Software)
146623.description:
Publisher Catalog

You have to be fast to keep up with the action as you try to outscore your opponent in five minutes of one-on-one basketball against a friend or our TRS-80 model I or III.

Steal the ball, duck around your opponent and slant toward the basket for a lay-up! The graphics are based on a 3-dimensional depiction of a basketball court, and ball dribbling sounds add to the realism. It's all there but the cheers in this fast, machine language game!

146624.name: Silhouette Cards
146624.description:
Silhouette Cards is played with a deck of cards with silhouette images.

Two cards are drawn from the deck. The first player to come up with a word that matches both cards keeps them both, and two new cards are drawn. When the deck is exhausted the player with the most cards wins.

146626.name: Pigskin
146626.description:
Publisher Catalog

Play football against a friend or your computer with PIGSKIN. It features a graphic display of the field, the ball and scoreboard statistics. When you have the ball you choose from eleven offensive plays while your opponent picks which of the seven defenses might stop you--77 possible play options in all! The 30-second clock and a variety of penalty calls keep you on your toes.

If you play against your TRS-80, there are five levels of difficulty. And they aren't easy! You can even save a game for later completion.

146627.name: Astroball
146627.description:
Publisher's Catalog

More features, thrills, and sound than even our famous PINBALL. With ASTROBALL in your TRS-80 model I or III the arrow keys become flipper buttons, the screen becomes the play board, and you become the "Pinball Wizard!"

A flying saucer and moving spaceships add to the fun. Knocking out five meteors earns you an extra ball, while black holes swallow the ball in play.

ASTROBALL's five skill levels will have all your family and friends lining up for the pinball action.

146628.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Nyan Nyan
146628.description:
From box back:

Few Freyjan's ever leave the frozen spires of the Frostbyte Reach. Those who do are captivated by wanderlust and endless curiosity. Nyan-Nyan shares the curious lucky streak common among her people, allowing her to escape the most dire situations unharmed. Now your adventuring party can press their luck by enlisting this unique Hero to the cause of defending Crystalia.

146629.description: Trains: Gen Con 2013 is a single-sided game board for use with Trains that features the landscape of Indianapolis and Indiana (USA); it includes the Gen Con logo as part of the city of Indianapolis. This expansion was included as part of AEG's "Swag Bag" for attendees of the AEG 2013 Big Game Night event at Gen Con 2013.
146629.name: Trains: Gen Con 2013

146630.name: Pinball (TRS-80)
146630.description:
Publisher's Catalog

Get your flipper fingers ready for action in this real-time, machine language game.

Lots of sound and flashing graphics make this fact action game so much like the real thing that you'll have to remind yourself not to shake your TRS-80. Choose from five playing speeds to match your skill. Can you beat your friends' scores? Will you avoid the infamous "Bermuda Square?" Get PINBALL today and find out.

146631.description:
GenCon 2013 Promo Card, Spell (Magic, Arcane, Divine, Attack, Fire)

Acquisition Check: 6 (Intelligence, Arcane, Wisdom, Divine)


Powers*


For your combat check, discard this card to roll your Arcane or Divine die + 1d12 with the Fire trait.

Discard this card to add 1d4 with the Fire trait to a combat check using a weapon.

If you do not have either the Arcane or Divine skill, banish this card.


Recharge*


Succeed at an Arcane or Divine 8 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.
146631.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – "Fire Sneeze" Promo Card
boardgameexpansion: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set

146632.description:
August Subscriber's Promo Card

Ally (Goblin, Cleric)
Acquisition Check: 7 (Charisma, Diplomacy, Divine)

Powers:

Recharge this card to add 3 with the Fire trait to a combat check.
Bury this card to recharge 1d4 random cards from your discard pile.
Discard this card to explore your location.
146632.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – "Poog of Zarongel" Promo Card
boardgameexpansion: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set

146633.name: Papa's Burgeria
146633.description:
User Summary

You will be in charge of a fast food restaurant serving burgers to customers. Take the order, fry the patties and build the toppings and additional ingredients to finish the sandwich. Fry and build the sandwich as quickly and accurately for bigger tips. Spend tips on items to improve your shop.

146634.name: That's Beez Wax
146634.description:
(from DriveThruCards)

Are you sure that you can trust your friends and family? Perhaps it’s time to put them to the test. That’s Beez Wax challenges a person’s integrity as well as their ability to cover up a lie. Player’s take turns laying cards face down in sequential order in an effort to empty their hand. Those caught lying will get buried by “The Hive.” Those falsely accused will experience sweet redemption. The player who avoids the “Stinger” and tastes the sweet nectar of victory will be forever known as King or Queen Bee.

Once a player has won a round, all other players must add up the point values of the cards remaining in their hands.

The player with the lowest score after 5 rounds wins the game.

146635.name: Gunship: Anti-Fighter Turret Promo
146635.description:
Available at GenCon 2013

This is a ship part (single card) that provides specific anti-fighter defenses to your ship.

146636.name: Papa's Pancakeria
146636.description:
User Summary

Run will be running a pancake shop. Take the customers orders, fry their pancakes and then put on toppings. Get bigger tips if you prepare them quickly and accurately and cook the pancakes well. Use the tips you earn to make improvements to your store to increase the score and the tips you will earn.

146637.name: Tenpin
146637.description:
Publisher's Catalog

John Allen works his machine language magic again, bringing all the thrills of championship bowling to your TRS-80 model I or III.

From one to four players participate, and the program automatically senses the skill of each player. Beginners can simply position the ball and "roll" it while more skilled players can vary the force, curve and spin as it heads for the pins. All this--plus 3-D graphics and sound effects--adds up to a realistic and thoroughly challenging bowling game.

146638.name: Invaders From Space
146638.description:
Publisher's Catalog

A fast machine language approach to this classic (and addictive) space game. The aliens drop bombs, move around, and try to overrun your bases.

You choose the speed, enemy bomb frequency and accuracy, and how many shots and bases you have. Unlike other games of this type, you can move your base and simultaneously fire at the invaders. Fun for all ages and skill levels, it has full sound effects for even more excitement.

146639.name: Papa's Pizzeria
146639.description:
User Summary

In this game you will be managing a Pizzaria. You must take customers orders, put on the toppings, bake the pizza and then cut the slices. Customers will tip you better if you are fast and accurate. You can spend the money you earn to upgrade the shop so that it is more efficient and more appealing to customers. This will earn you even more points.

146640.name: Everest Explorer
146640.description:
Publisher's Catalog

Towering above the clouds, the summit of Mount Everest is a forbidding spot. Only a handful of daring adventurers have made it to this five-mile-high pinnacle where the air is thin, violent storms erupt with little warning, and danger lurks at every footfall.

EVEREST EXPLORER lets you challenge the world's highest mountain without ever leaving home. This logistical simulation goes beyond most adventures, forcing you to make all the life-or-death decisions required at every step of the attempt.

Assigned an expedition budget, you must select the manpower, food, fuel, shelter and oxygen supplies you will need to support your quest. Now the adventure begins as you manipulate your resources to outwit the elements and terrain, establishing ever higher encampments. Weather, route, season, climbers' condition and morale all play key roles in the final question: will you reach Everest's 29,028 foot summit--and return to tell about it?

146642.name: Papa's Wingeria
146642.description:
User Summary

In this game you will be managing a chicken wing restaurant. You must take customer orders, fry the wings, put the sauce on them and plate the orders. Customers will tip you based on speed and accuracy of the orders. You can spend the money you earn upgrading the shop with equipment and entertainment for the customers. This will allow you to earn even more points.

146643.name: Papa's Taco Mia!
146643.description:
User Summary

In Papa's Taco Mia! you must manage a taco restaurant. You take orders from customers, fry the meat and put on the toppings and sauces. You will earn tips based on how quickly and accurately you prepare the orders. The money you earn can be used to upgrade the shop and improve customer experience and make cooking more efficient. This will allow you to earn even more points.

146644.name: Papa's Hot Doggeria
146644.description:
User Summary

In Papa's Hot Doggeria you manage a hot dog stand at a stadium.
You must take customers orders, grill the hot dogs, build the sandwich with toppings and condiments and then get them a soda. The faster and more accurately you put together the customers order the more tips you will earn. You can spend money to purchase amenities for the customer and devices to make the food production faster and more efficient.

146645.name: Santorini (unpublished)
146645.description:
Santorini is a unique 2-player tile-placement game featuring a nearly vertical playing surface. Your goal is to be the first to place all of your hotels so that their views are captivating. Players take turns placing interlocking hexagonal tiles on the inclined board, stacking upwards from the shoreline at the bottom. Each tile shows an isometric view of a portion of the village.

A hotel's view is defined as the collection of tiles below it. Each hotel caps a triangular shaped view. Blue domes, a signature architectural feature of the Santorini region, enhance the view (+1). Your opponent's hotels detract from the view (-1). You don't want your guests looking out at your competition, right?

Players start with 6 hotels. Each hotel has a number of windows.
One 1-window
Two 2-window
Two 3-window
One 4-window

In order to place a hotel, its view must contain at least as many blue dome tiles as the hotel has windows. Your opponent's hotels subtract from this number.

The first player to place all 6 of her hotels is the winner.

146646.description: As a Kickstarter stretch reward, the expansion's four top-tier technologies were provided to backers in a special foil edition. They are functionally identical to the normal cards that are included in Legacy: Forbidden Machines; they are just fancy stand-ins for the originals, in case you like to show off.
146646.name: Legacy: Forbidden Machines – Foil Apex Technologies

146647.description:
This is a small punchboard designed to facilitate tracking your actions when playing Legacy: Gears of Time, or your actions and optional technology activation when playing Legacy: Forbidden Machines. It was originally offered as a stretch reward for backers of the Kickstarter project for Legacy: Forbidden Machines.

No instructions are given for its use; however, one method you can use is to punch out the holes as you use those actions, then return them to the tracker for the next player's turn. The intended mode of use is to employ a cube or two, but considering that you can run short of cubes, the no-cube solution of eternally re-punching the tracker is a good option.
146647.name: Legacy Action Tracking Promo

146648.name: Space War (TRS-80)
146648.description:
Publisher Catalog

A two-player, real-time action game that lets each player control a spaceship with rotate, thrust, fire, and hyperspace. Dive in and engage in an interstellar dogfight, turning and twisting as you engage your opponent or run for the cover of hyperspace!

Five game options (including gravity) and three playing speeds. The action gets fast and furious in this fast, machine language game.

146649.description:
More options, more fun and tons more destruction! It's the Gunship: Arsenal!

This expansion collects 3 of the previous expansions into one set. Additionally, it adds new carriers to allow proper 4 players games.

This set includes:

From Gunship: First Strike! X-perimental Weapons
80 Upgrade Cards - Awesome new gunship weapons plus fighter and carrier upgrades!

From Gunship: Crewmates!
18 Crewmate Cards - Recruit characters with special abilities to crew your vessels!

From Gunship: Asteroids!
36 Asteroid Cards - New mini-game and battlespace terrain!

From Gunship: Green and White Carrriers
2 Carrier Boards - Unlocks 3-player and 4-player free-for-all modes!

2 12-sided dice - For use with the new carriers!

From Gunship: Tokens Expansion
1 Sheet of Punchboard Tokens - Die-cut ships for more sci-fi theme!
146649.name: Gunship: Arsenal!

146650.name: Fireknife!
146650.description:
For centuries, Samoan warriors have spun and tossed their weapons in dazzling demonstrations of courage and skill. The traditional wooden war clubs were later replaced with hooked steel machetes. In 1946, a young knife dancer, “Freddie” Letuli, was performing in San Francisco at an event that also featured a Hindu fire eater and a girl who twirled a baton with light bulbs on the ends. Letuli wrapped some towels around the ends of his knife, dipped them in fuel, set them alight, and invented fireknife dancing.

The fireknife dance (siva afi) is now a major feature of Samoan culture and the pinnacle of any lu’au.

In the Fireknife! card game, players take on the role of fireknife dancers, trying to impress the audience with the best routines. The first player to earn enough points (acclaim from the audience) wins.

There are 100 cards in the deck. Most of these represent moves that a dancer might perform, but a few are mistakes to be played on other players. In addition to the cards, players will need pencil and paper to keep score.

Fireknife! is intended as a light or family game. Mechanically, it is related to Mille Bornes or Mystery Rummy: Jack the Ripper. There are also echoes of Ticket to Ride (“Should I take more stuff or use what I've accumulated?”) and Kill Dr. Lucky (“Should I stop the leader from scoring or hope someone else can do it?”).

146651.name: The Bureau: XCOM Declassified
146651.description:
The Bureau: XCOM Declassified is a science fiction video game in the X-COM series, developed by 2K Marin and released by 2K Games for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 on August 20, 2013 in North America. The game was in development under different titles by three different studios since 2006. It was unveiled as a first-person shooter titled XCOM in June 2010 and it has been repeatedly delayed and changed since then. In April 2013, the game was rebranded as The Bureau: XCOM Declassified in its final version of a third-person view tactical shooter with strategy video game elements.

Set in the United States in 1962, the game tells the story of the CIA special agent William Carter, working for the United States Bureau of Strategic Emergency Command, tasked with investigating and stopping an extraterrestrial incursion on American soil, all while keeping it a secret and erasing all evidence.

The Bureau is a third-person shooter with an emphasis on squad-based tactics. The player controls William Carter and commands two additional agents in each mission. Carter has his own unique abilities, but other agents are divided into the Commando, Engineer, Support, and Recon classes. By entering "Battle Focus Mode", which slows time significantly, the player can order their agents to move to strategic positions and activate class-specific abilities. Agents have customizable outfits, weapons, equipment and abilities. As in XCOM: Enemy Unknown, soldiers will suffer from permanent death and if Carter is unable to revive agents who have taken too much damage, they will die (variable difficulty levels also determine whether or not it is possible for downed agents to become battle-ready when revived, or if replacement agents will appear during a mission).

Source: Wikipedia, "The Bureau: XCOM Declassified", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Taking on the role of protagonists such as Ripley, Dallas, Bishop and Corporal Hicks, players take turns recruiting cards for their deck from a central selection in order to improve their deck and defeat Xenomorph cards that are added to the central game board.

146653.name: The Chantry Keep
rpgissuearticle: Adventures in Awesfur - The Dark Totem pt.1: The Chantry Keep
146653.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A boy is missing. A desecrated temple outside of town was the last place anyone wanted to look. Now, the boy's father and the people of Varatolo have scrounged up enough money to hire an adventuring party to search for the boy. Dark and forbidding, the ancient temple has fallen to ruin. Do you have the courage to scour through the darkness, deep into the past of the Wyldelands? Can you return with the boy safely, or will you succumb to what evil lurks within?

Adventures in Awesfur are a series of adventure modules compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and published under the Open Gaming License. The Dark Totem Part 1: The Chantry Keep is intended as an introduction to the setting and the beginning to an ongoing campaign. You may also use this adventure in your own favorite setting and campaign to add an air of dark fantasy or hints of a better past.

This adventure is intended for four or five third-level characters. Also includes printer-friendly PDF with no parchment background!

Also includes:


Setting information on the world of Awesfur and the Wyldelands!
Varatolo, the city of Wizards!
The Blind Basilisk Bar with complete menu, list of services and NPCs to run it!
Read about the opposed Deities, Galayne and Obirag!
The Chantry Keep, a fully realized adventure location dripping with history!
2 original NPC opponents: Caleb Sutter, the mad ghoul and Seletok, hobgoblin cleric to Obirag!
A brand new haunt: The Forsaken Forge!
Full color maps, including full-sized combat maps! Easy as print and play!

146654.name: The Dead Dragon's Den
146654.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Continue the quest to learn of the Dark Totem and its secrets! Adventure awaits, as your PCs delve into the Westgaard Mine to challenge Verbrennung the skeletal dragon!

Adventures in Awesfur are a series of adventure modules compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and published under the Open Gaming License. The Dark Totem Part 2: The Dead Dragon's Den is intended as an introduction to the setting and the beginning to an ongoing campaign. You may also use this adventure in your own campaign to add an air of dark fantasy or hints of a better past.

This adventure is intended for a party of third or fourth-level characters.

Additional Features:


A group of memorable NPC merchants for your PCs to deal with. Why make a trip to the shop boring when your players can meet Clarence the mimic?
Daring Deeds, a series of urban mini-adventures in the city of Varatolo.
Westgaard mine, brought to life in pain-staking detail with a full-color map!
Nearly a dozen original NPC opponents! Can your PCs face the might of Verbrennung, the skeletal dragon?
Devious new traps. Who does it better than kobolds?
Player reference map, with no room numbers or trap indicators.
Full spell list for all NPC spell casters. No need to dig through all your books looking for a spell description!

146660.description:
User Summary

The player takes control of a little Monster and guides him through his wild life. Every day the player has to make choices that will shape the character of the monster and affect his standing in the monster society. Will he change anything? Will his actions even lead to a war with the humans?

The game features no animations - just some (cute) background graphics and plain text. Every interaction is through a simple dialogue structure.

146661.name: Northern Gun 1
146661.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rifts® Northern Gun™ One is the biggest 'tech' filled World Book Palladium has ever produced. In addition to world information, background and O.C.C.s for the Northern Gun corporation and Ishpeming, there are 27 robots, 70+ weapons and all kinds of dynamic information and gaming resources. Courtesy of the largest arms dealer and independent manufacturer on the continent: Northern Gun™.

Northern Gun™ is the most famous arms manufacture in North America. Outside of the Coalition States, one could argue, no other kingdom is as powerful or influential, at least when it comes to technology and weapons. The manufacture and sale of Northern Gun weapons and vehicles has given virtually every kingdom, town, colony of settlers and adventurer group a chance to survive and prosper. Located in Michigan's Upper Peninsula, NG has been the premier outfitter of mercenaries, adventurers and upstart kingdoms for generations. Now, for the first time ever, learn Northern Gun's history, goals and plans for the future. Of course, that means new weapons, robots, power armor, vehicles and gear.

In-depth look at Northern Gun, its robots, stores, politics and operations.
70+ NG weapons; old and new.
27 NG giant combat and exploration robots. Described in detail.
Many new robot weapon systems and features, including alternative power supplies, anti-monster gear and experimental weapons.
Northern Gun freighter ships and hovertrains. Random Cargo tables too.
Notable cities and people of the Ishpeming Republic/Northern Gun.
NG O.C.C.s, police, specialists and NG Mercenary army.
The NG Mercenary army and police.
The NG Bounty Board, the largest collection of bounties and mercenary contracts anywhere on Rifts Earth.
Key locations, people and dangers around Northern Gun.
NG mercenary defenders, groups and pirates.
Northern Gun's relationship with the CS and other nations.

146662.name: Le projet du siècle: Jeu sur la construction des ouvrages du Complexe La Grande de la Baie James
146662.description:
[Adapted and translated from the French-language rules]

The development of the energy potential around James Bay is without a doubt the greatest technological adventure in Quebec's history. To transform this vast network of lakes, rivers and forests into an enormous hydro-electricity complex is a great challenge. Le Projet du siècle invits you to think on this challenge and to experience all the steps of constructing a hydro-electricity complex.

Le Projet du siècle spans a diverse territory: camps, dozens of construction sites, giant dams, levees and other building works. For this game, we used actual technical drawings from the LG2 dam, encompassing the power station, the 2.8 km dam and over 30 levees, for a total of 46 million square kilometers of building works. Other illustrations refer to other parts of the La Grande Complexe.

The aim of the game is to be the first to construct a hydro-electricity complex. Each their turn, players will develop their own construction techniques. It is important to read the rules book for each step of the game.

The game has two main phases, each with their own track on the board. First is the Organization phase, where players acquires Exploration, Project, Financing and Worker cards to begin a Construction site. In the Construction phase, players will build dams, levees and their power station. Opportunities to act will be determined by the places on the board a player rolls and moves to.

146664.name: Wake the Dead
146664.description:
From Introduction:

An Adventure for Gears & Gaslights

In the year 1297 during the First War of Scottish Independence, at a place called Stirling Bridge (conveniently located near the town of Stirling), a decisive victory was won for the Scotts, with over 100 English cavalry, and 5000 English infantry slaughtered, and an unknown number of Scotts.

Of note, the Scotts lost a valuable leader, Andrew de Moray, and the English lost a hated (by everyone apparently) leader, Hugh de Cressingham. It is these two souls that this adventure revolves around.

So What Now?

The caretaker for the current Cambuskenneth Abbey, of which only the bell tower remains, one Dubh Innis has sent out the word that his Abbey, and the nearby site of the Battle of Stirling Bridge has become haunted, and needs assistance in the eradication of spirits. He will pay.

Lucky for our heroes, they are the first to arrive on scene.

The caravan is leaving soon, don't get left behind.

146673.name: Mper Adventure Book 3: The Gold Road (Pathfinder Edition)
146673.description:
From publisher blurb:

Visit one of the longest continiously running RPG campaigns.

The adventure detailed in part 1 continues. The characters must help the guards fight off bandits and then help the caravan get to the Gold Road in order to be safe.

Included in this issue is a map of Sadakadish (the continent) as well as encounter charts for road hazards and minor encounters.

146674.name: Boreal Bestiary (Pathfinder)
146674.description:
From publisher blurb:

A magnificent bestiary of frozen fear!

This supplement contains over a dozen monsters and variants that prowl the harsh and bitter climes of north. From fey spirits hungry and cruel to hard-hearted hunters and feral giants, even the tundra itself comes alive with menace in its mind and hate in its heart in Beasts of Legend: Boreal Bestiary from Legendary Games. Drawing upon real-world folklore and legends as well as classic tropes of fantasy and horror, the Boreal Bestiary presents richly developed creatures replete with inventive abilities alongside detailed lore and ecology, all designed by the top creative minds in the business, with monsters from Jason Nelson, Tim Hitchcock, and Matt Goodall and amazing art by Tanyaporn Sangsnit, Jason Juta, and Frank Hessefort.

With beautiful full-color layout, full-page illustrations, and printable miniatures, this 40-page product delivers monsters from CR 1 to CR 17, Beasts of Legend: Boreal Bestiary is a terrific addition to any GM's monster toolkit when their adventures head into the cold and wild lands, whether in your home campaign or in Adventure Paths like the Kingdom-Building, Far East, Witches of Winter, or Righteous Crusade AP.

146675.description:
This expansion to the The Duke core game adds additional siege engine tiles as well as an engineer to utilize the siege engines to their full potential.

The players lay the five tiles from the expansion pack on the side of the board, then start a standard game. Whenever a player pulls one of the five tiles noted below, they can choose at the moment to replace the drawn tile with the appropriate tile from this expansion pack. If the player decides not to replace the tile, he cannot replace the tile at any future time. Yes, this means a single player could have all five tiles on their side.

These tiles replace the following tiles in the game:

Battering Ram = Marshal
Trebuchet = Knight
Catapult = General
Ballista = Priest
Engineer = Oracle

There are several new icons introduced with this expansion; Smash, Hammer, Area-Effect, and Non-capturing Move/Jump icons. Additionally, two new Enhanced Abilities are added, Redeploy (V) and Link (VI).
146675.name: The Duke: Middle Ages Siege Engines Expansion

146676.name: Chaos in the Wildlands
146676.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Wildlands is a frontier region lying between the civilized realms and the southern untamed lands, which are home to foul beasts and fierce humanoid tribes. Various keeps and castles stand watch along the border, guarding the mountain passes and river valleys that would otherwise provide marauders and monsters with easy access to the civilized realms. One such keep is Drake Hall, the seat of power for Baron Richard Drake. The Baron's family has defended the border for more than a century, but recently things have taken a turn for the worse. Things are about to reach a tipping point, unless an intrepid group of adventurerers can save the day.

Chaos in the Wildlands is an adventure front for the Dungeon World RPG. It presents the skeleton of a complete original adventure, inspired by a classic old-school TSR module from the 1980s. With it and a minimal amount of prep work, a GM has enough material for several sessions of play, as well as the set-up for a longer campaign arc.

146677.name: Trip Hopeful Board Game
146677.description:
"Trip Hopeful" is singleplayer board game based on the indie game from PC, "Organ Trail Director's Cut". It is a experience roleplay. The random will decide the fate of your character (with a dice). The game consist of twenty cards of event, the table-score and map (U.S. map).

You will cross the United States to find a safe settlement for win. You'll go from point to point until the end. On each dice roll will advance through these points. There will be large and small roads that will consume different amounts of gasoline and battery. There are also radioactive areas in which you can lose health. Depending on your tierada you can find places you can get a supplies as ammunition or medicines. On your way you will meet shortcuts by which you can cross but all depends on your luck with the dice. You'll dincount or count point while advance.

The game is available in Spanish and English. And soon, I'll make expansions with more maps and event cards (maybe multiplayer)

Most importantly, the game is complete and all the rules for the two language

146678.name: Dewey's Victory: Never Beaten
146678.description: Parker Brothers' strategy board game, "Dewey's Victory: Never Beaten" carries a bold box cover graphic showing Admiral Dewey himself. The game doubtless appealed to boys who idolized Dewey after his famous naval victory at Manila Bay during the Philippine War, in 1900.

146679.name: Hoeren. Spielen. Radio.
146679.description:
A promotion game by Radio Cologne (Germany). The title means listening, gaming, radio.

The game is played on a board that resembles the city map of Cologne. Players move by rolling a "pyramid die" (pyramid shaped die, each side has 3 numbers on it, the number on the bottommost side counts). Each player gets a mission card like "do cover news at site x", must move there, and gets a new one after fulfilling it. After 5 mission cards are completed a player can move back to home base. The first one completing 5 missions and returning to base is the winner.

The game board also contains yellow "program fields" where players must draw a program card and answer questions about Radio Colognes programs. If answered correctly they get a reward, if incorrectly a punishment like 1 step back. Red "chance fields" means a chance card has to be drawn and this means maybe a free turn etc.

146682.description:
"Be thou Sire or Slave?"

Lord of the Realm is a fast paced Trading-Building-Conquest collectible card game that challenges your negotiation, tactics and building strategy.
You are a noble vying for domination of the Forests, Plains and Mountains with other nobles, in the fantasy realm of Everon.

You win by building up your land, getting rich by making metal, getting victory points by upgrading your buildings or by sending units to capture another’s buildings. Only the richest or strongest will become Lord of the Realm.

How to win by Victory points:
You can win upgrading most basic buildings to advanced buildings with a V symbol (victory points). You need only 5 to win, but they can be captured if not defended!

How to win by making metal:
Buildings that produce metal (coin). You need 9 coins to win. Again, if not defended these can be captured together with all the metal in them!

How to win by conquest:
Build defences and buildings that can recruit the Men, Elves and Dwarves that populate the realm. You can upgrade these troops with metal via a blacksmith or armoury!

DESCRIPTION:
New discoveries await you in this exciting expansion for the award-winning Eclipse, with powerful new technology, ancient alien vessels, and two new species. Try the new turn order variant, explore the new outer sector, and win power for your faction through judicious use of the security council.

Best of all, Eclipse: Ship Pack One includes 108 new plastic models, enough for every player to have different ships on the board! With so much to add to the base game, players will find all new reasons to take to the stars.

FEATURES
•The same great art and production quality as the original game.
•New factions, discoveries, technologies, and more.
•New turn order variant adds another strategic element.

146691.name: Amoebelli
146691.description:
Amoebelli is played by two, each player having six stones of black or white, on a board made of staggered alternating rows of five or six squares. (There are five rows of six squares with four rows of five squares sandwiched between them so that each square in the short rows shares a border with two squares in the adjoining long rows.) Twelve central squares are highlighted, six each in two colors; these are the starting zones for each player.

Players begin by placing their stones in the starting squares, then take turns moving and capturing each other's pieces. Pieces jump in any of six directions to an open space opposite the jumped piece, and jumps may continue in a string if more jumps are possible. Jumped pieces are removed and then added again to the board at the end of the turn, in any open square adjacent to the piece that was used to jump them. If there are no open spaces, the pieces are removed from the game permanently.

The game is lost if a player fails to have one of his own pieces on one of his starting squares at the end of his turn, or if a player finds he has no available moves.
