146887.name: Bomberman Collection (GB)
146887.description:
User Summary

Bomberman Collection is a compilation video game released for the Game Boy. It was only released in Japan and features three game boy bomberman games in one pack:

Bomber Boy
Bomberman GB
Bomberman GB 2

146888.name: NBA LIVE 14
146888.description:
Powered by the EA SPORTS IGNITE engine, NBA LIVE 14 will deliver the ultimate on-the-court control. Utilizing its new BounceTek technology, NBA LIVE 14 will introduce a revolutionary new, physics-based dribbling system. Whether it’s Ricky Rubio’s crossover or Kyrie Irving’s devastating between the legs dribble, one-on-one matchups take on a whole new meaning by putting the creativity and control at the core of every move.

By utilizing the same data used by all 30 NBA teams, more than 70 unique statistics and tendencies will fuel every single player on the court. From the way they move, to the way they play, to the decisions they make, NBA LIVE player will evolve throughout the season with updates from every NBA game within one hour of a game’s final buzzer. Gamers will now have a new experience every time they pick-up the controller.

Source: The Publisher Website.

146889.name: Need for Speed: Rivals
videogamehonor: 2013 Game Critics Best Racing Game of the Year Winner
2013 Spike (VGX) Best Driving Game of the Year Nominee
2014 D.I.C.E. Racing Game of the Year Nominee
146889.description:
Live the ongoing rivalry between the opposing sides of Cop and Racer. Racers are lone wolves out for their own glory; driving agile cars built for high speed racing and epic chases. Cops work in teams to hunt down and bust racers using the full power of the police force. Switch roles at any time and watch the stakes grow in an all-new scoring system that lets you put your speed points on the line to earn even greater rewards.

Source: The Game Website.

146890.name: Peggle 2
videogamehonor: 2014 D.I.C.E. Casual Game of the Year Nominee
146890.description:
Catch the Hottest Fever Ever: Peggle Fever

You’re invited to bounce into a wondrous new world of Peggle — one of “the top 5 most addictive games of all time.”* Shoot balls at colorful, challenging boards of pegs to reach Extreme Fever in this astounding new Xbox experience.

Unleash the amazing magic powers of Peggle Masters like Bjorn, and all-new masters like the dark and mysterious Luna, as you attempt to conquer new boards and challenges. The peg-busting phenomenon is coming soon to Xbox One

Source: [www.popcap.com/peggle-2 The Publisher Website].

146891.name: Powerstar Golf
146891.description:
User Summary

Powerstar Golf is a golf game coming to Xbox One Live Arcade at launch.

146892.name: Coryoon: Child of Dragon
146892.description:
User Summary

A horizontal shoot em up starring a young dragon trying to rescue a princess. You can eat eggs and collect items in order to gain powerups. Each stage has two bosses and the stage design reflects the stage boss. Once a level is completed you can also choose to play the level again through a stage select mode.

146893.name: Skylanders: Swap Force
videogameversion: Skylanders: Swap Force – European Xbox 360 Edition German
videogamehonor: 2013 Game Critics Best Social/Casual/Puzzle Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Spike (VGX) Best Casual Game of the Year Nominee
2014 British Academy Game Awards Best Family/Children's Game of the Year Nominee
2014 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee
146893.description:
Embark on a new adventure in Skylanders SWAP Force. The new game introduces the SWAP Force Skylanders characters. These Skylanders have the unique ability to mix and match their top and bottom parts to create new characters with different in-game abilities and powers.

Source: The Game Website.

videogamehonor: 2013 Game Critics Best Action Game of the Year Winner
2013 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Winner
2013 Game Critics Best of Show Winner
2013 Game Critics Best Online Multiplayer of the Year Winner

2015 D.I.C.E. Best Animation of the Year Nominee

2015 SXSW Best Animation of the Year Nominee
2015 SXSW Best Gameplay of the Year Nominee
2015 SXSW Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2015 SXSW Best Sound Effects of the Year Nominee
146894.description:
Crafted by one of the co-creators of Call of Duty and other key developers behind the Call of Duty franchise, Titanfall is among the most highly anticipated games of 2014, having been shrouded in mystery for nearly three years. The visionaries at Respawn have drawn inspiration from their proven experience in first-person action gaming, and are building on that pedigree by taking a new approach to game design and creating an all-new universe with Titanfall.
Fast-Paced Advanced Combat

The advanced combat techniques of Titanfall give you the freedom to fight your way as both elite assault Pilot and fast, heavily armored Titan.

"The Titan moves with speed and grace normally reserved for general infantry and handles like an extension of the Pilot himself, holding a weapon in a first-person view." - Game Informer
The Future of Online Multiplayer

Introducing the experience that combines fast-paced multiplayer action with the dramatically charged moments of a cinematic universe.

Source: The Game Website.

146895.name: Faussete Amour
videogameversion: Japanese PC Engine Super CD edition
146895.description:
User Summary

A side scrolling action game. Your character wields an extending metallic baton that can be swung in any direction and can be used to attach and swing from walls. Similar to Ghost and Goblins the first time your character is hit she loses her armor and is then in a single piece bikini.

146897.name: SNK Gals Fighters
videogameversion: English/European Neo Geo Pocket Color edition
Japanese Neo Geo Pocket Color edition
146897.description:
User Summary

A fighter that plays like King of Fighters with the addition of a "pretty burst" special move for each character that can do thins like refiling or draining health. Each character also has a secret pose they can do.

146898.name: Simutek Package Three
146898.description:
Publisher's Catalog

Package Three Includes:

Poetry -- This program lets you choose the subject as well as the mood of the poem you want. You give TRS-80 certain nouns or names, then the mood, and it does the rest! It has a 1000-word + vocabulary of nouns, verbs, adjectives and adverbs!

Electric Artist -- Manual draw, erase, move as well as Auto draw, erase and move! Uses graphics bits not bytes. Saves drawing on tape or disk!

Galactic Battle -- The Swineus enemy have long range phasers but cannot travel at warp speed! You can, but only have short range phasers! Can you blitzkrieg the enemy without getting destroyed! Full graphics -- real time!

Word Mania -- Can you guess the computer's words using your human intuitive and logical abilities? You'll need to, to beat the computer!

Air Command — Battle the Kamikaze pilots. Requires split second timing. This is a FAST action arcade game.

146899.name: Sengoku Blade: Sengoku Ace Episode II
videogamecompilation: Psikyo Shooting Collection Vol. 2: Sengoku Ace & Sengoku Blade
146899.description:
User Summary

The first sequel to Sengoku Ace, unlike the first game this is a horizontal shoot em up and instead of flying planes the characters fly around the screen as themselves while they attack with familiars.

146900.name: Psikyo Shooting Collection Vol. 2: Sengoku Ace & Sengoku Blade
videogamecompilation: Sengoku Blade: Sengoku Ace Episode II
146900.description:
User Summary

A compilation containing the arcade shoot em ups Sengoku Ace and Sengoku Blade.

146901.name: Sengoku Cannon: Sengoku Ace Episode III
146901.description:
User Summary

A horizontal shoot em up and the third in the Sengoku Ace series. There are longer levels than the previous game but also less of them, branching paths and have also been taken out of the game. The game features four characters and two unlockable ones.

146902.name: Karthador
146902.description:
From Back Cover

Karthador is a world of beauty, danger, drama, and horror.

A world where swashbuckling heroes battle merciless villains across ancient vistas and above shining cities, in a world where science is magic, and adventure is never more than a whisper away.

Noble warriors ride dinosaurs into battle, swords in their hands and blaster pistols on their hips.

Crafty sky traders dodge air pirates and thread the needle of storm clouds in the name of profit.

Scholars sift through ancient ruins, looking for bits of eldritch technology to complete their new inventions.

Kings and revolutions pore over maps, looking for high ground and choke points, ever wondering if their engrgy crystals will hold out just a little longer...

What adventures await you?

146904.name: Honoo no Ryōrijin: Cooking Fighter Hao
146904.description:
User Summary

Play as the master chef Hao as he goes around challenging other chefs to cooking battles. The game is played in a top down arena where you must hunt down the animal you need, as well as find seasoning and vegetables in order to create your dish. Perform special moves to decide what dish you create. The animals can attack you but the enemy chef is also able to attack and steal your dishes and ingredients.

The game has a single player story and a two player versus mode where you can select any of the 11 chefs.

146905.name: Sol Divide: Sword of Darkness
146905.description:
User Summary

A horizontal shoot em up that has elements of a beat em up, RPG, and rougelike. You are able to shoot, use spells, and perform close range attacks that can be made into combos. There are three characters, each one getting a unique combo and spell, and each starting on a different stage.

The Playstation and Saturn versions of the game included a new mode that had you go through a 17 floor dungeons gaining experience from defeating enemies and finding new items along the way. If you die you taken all the way back to the start, you lose your level and your increased stats are cut in half but you keep any items that you have gained.

The American Playstation version of the game was not fully translated, removed scenes, what was translated was poorly done, and it removed the ability to save the game.

A PS2 version was released in Europe that left the scenes intact but removed the 17 floor dungeon mode.

146906.name: Psikyo Shooting Collection Volume 3
146906.description:
User Summary

A compilation of Psikyo's shoot em up games Sol Divide and Dragon Blaze.

146907.name: Cities in Motion 2
videogamehonor: 2013 Global Game Awards Best Management Game of the Year Nominee
146907.description:
Build the transport network of the future

Build the transport network of the future. Face new challenges and new modes of play. Contend with day night cycles, dynamic cities and more. Organize timetables to bring order out of chaos. When nothing goes to plan adapt, or crash and burn.

Source: The Publisher Website.

146908.description:
Would you like to enjoy BASKETmind on a full basketball court? Now with BASKETmind+ you can: using the base game rules and components, a second board, plus a few rules to handle transitions between boards, you will get even closer to the experience of a basketball match.

Although the rules remain simple, the tactical depth increases: now you do not only try to score; the position in which you lose/intercept the ball, or the placement of your players after a shot, does matter. Offensive rebounds introduce new choices, as well as time-outs: when will be the best moment to call them?
146908.name: BASKETmind+

146909.description:
Skunk is a trick-taking game, where players must avoid skunks. The deck has 1-10 in four colours (red, green, yellow, blue). There are skunks in the nines of the suits and in every card of the red suit.

The game play is basic trick-taking. Follow the suit, no trump, highest card wins the trick. In the end, players count their skunks. The player with the least skunks after six rounds wins the game.
146909.name: Skunk

146910.description:
Wildcatters is a tactical and strategic board game set during the booming business of the 19th century oil industry!

The players are oil barons who develop oil fields; bid for oil rights; and build rigs, oil tankers, trains, and refineries. Your goal is to deliver more oil barrels to the continents than the other players while also collecting more shares and money then them.

The game lasts seven rounds with four players, and the game set-up is the same for each player, with three rigs, two trains, one tanker and one refinery being placed on the board. The game board features a world map divided into eight areas where you can find oil. Players choose an open area card and get money to build rigs, tankers, trains and refineries, after which they can buy oil actions. The players work together in an oilfield to find oil at a lower cost. The players transport oil together to the refineries, using trains and tankers from other players to deliver oil to the refineries – and all with one purpose: deliver more oil than the other players by the end of the game.
146910.name: Wildcatters
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 47 – Wildcatters
Heavy Cardboard Episode 1 – Madeira and Getting to Know You!
Heavy Cardboard Episode 39 – Top 50 Favorite Games of Right Now
Heavy Cardboard Episode 52 – Amanda’s Top 50 & Edward’s Top 50

146911.name: Voyage of the Stag Party
146911.description:
From the front cover:

On the trail of glory the hardy adventurers track stolen treasure on land and sea. Their fates hang in the balance: will they find their fortunes or only their doom?

Voyage of the Stag Party is designed for use with the d20 System as released in the System Reference Document under the Open Game License as pen Game COntent. It can easily fit into any fantasy campaign.

146913.name: The Howler
146913.description:
Vilnius, the capital of Lithuania, is a city where you can see hot air balloons flying over the roofs of the Old Town every day when the weather is clear. This is where the inspiration came from. Most of the places and buildings you see in the game actually exist in Vilnius today. Come to Vilnius to see them in real life!

The game is interlinked with the bestselling steampunk novel The HOUR OF THE WOLF by Andrius Tapinas. The English version is set to come out summer 2013.

The game can be played in a conventional click/touch manner or you can control everything by voice: a noise will push the balloon up, or keep quiet for it to descend. You can even drop parcels or bombs by making short loud noise.

The game was created by two people. The artwork is by Rene Petruliene: all the graphic design was drawn by hand, on paper, the old fashioned way. Antanas Marcelionis did the rest. The process took one year.

Source: The Game Website.

146914.name: Joining Hands
146914.description:
A handtastic puzzle game unlike anything you've ever seen before!

Enter the Whispering Woods and meet the Peablins! They are curious little creatures who share a common belief: hold hands with your friends and the Bogeyman won't take you. This has worked as long as they can remember so it must be true. Join the Peablins on their quest to find all their siblings and cousins!

Basic gameplay: drag and drop the Peablins so that all the hands in the level are joined and all the Peablins are happy. And remember: Leave no hand behind!

HIGHLIGHTS
--Simple and inventive
--Several kinds of Peablins that require different approaches
--Super cute high resolution graphics
--Hilarious sound effects
--Dozens of hand made levels
--No time limits, no enemies, no pressure. Just one more level...

Source: The Game Website.

146915.name: Simutek Package Four
146915.description:
Publisher's Catalog

Package Four Includes:

Life -- This Z-80 machine language program uses full graphics! Over 100 generations per minute make it truly animated! You make your starting pattern, the computer does the rest! Program can be stopped and changes made! Watch it grow!

Space Landers -- This full graphics simulator lets you pick what planet, asteroid or moon you wish to land on! Has 3 skill levels that make it fun for everyone.

Greed II -- Multi-level game is fun and challenging! Beat the computer at this dice game using your knowledge of odds and luck! Computer keeps track of his winnings and yours. Quick fast action. This game is not easy!

The Pharaoh -- Rule the ancient city of Alexandria! Buy or sell land. Keep your people from revolting! Stop the rampaging rats. Requires a true political personality to become good!

Robot Hunter -- A group of renegade robots have escaped and are spotted in ah old ghost town on Mars! Your job as "Robot Hunter" is to destroy the pirate machines before they kill any more settlers! Exciting! Challenging! Full graphics!

146916.description:
The turkeys on the farm are feasting away, but they must be careful! When Thanksgiving comes around, those turkeys that have made the deepest impression on the farm owner make perfect candidates to appear on the Thanksgiving dinner table. Would you, as a turkey in this game, be able to pig out with all that yummy food, but without becoming a dish yourself?

Happy Turkey Day! is a simultaneous-move game with each player taking the role of a voracious turkey. In the beginning of each round, each player takes one of the Action tokens in his/her hands, and places it, face down, on the playing surface in front of him/her. Then, all players turn over their tokens simultaneously and take an action: either grabbing some Food from a Hen House (i.e. Eat), or exercising to trim down a bit
(i.e. Lose Weight).

Each player has two goals in this game: first, getting a balanced diet by obtaining a variety of different Food cards – the wider the variety and the more the Food cards a player gets, the better the score; at the same time, each player should try to avoid getting marked Chubby whenever the Farm Owner makes an inspection to identify candidates for his Thanksgiving turkey dinner. At each inspection, the chubbiest turkey (as indicated by the highest number of Food cards held) will be given Chubby Markers. When Thanksgiving comes around, the turkey with the most Chubby Markers will be sent to the dinner table!

At the end of Thanksgiving, the survival turkey with the highest score wins! How to collect as many Food cards as possible, while avoiding getting Chubby Markers, is the key to winning this game.
146916.name: Happy Turkey Day!

146917.name: Tatu ja Patu: Virheistä viis
146917.description:
Tatu ja Patu – Virheistä viis has cards with two pictures. Players must find 5, 10 or 15 differences in the pictures and mark them on the cards with whiteboard pens. Players score 0-5 points depending on how many differences they find. There are several rounds played until someone gets 25 points.

The game art is based on popular Tatu and Patu children's books by Sami Toivonen and Aino Havukainen. The game play is based on Spot the Difference from University Games.

146918.name: Transport Giant: Gold Edition
146918.description:
User Summary

Transport Giant: Gold edition is a compilation of Transport Giant and Transport Giant Down Under.

146919.name: Neverwinter Nights 2 Gold
videogamecompilation: Neverwinter Nights 2: Mask of the Betrayer
146919.description:
User Summary

A compilation disc including the base game and the Mask of the Betrayer expansion.

146920.name: MLB Chipz
146920.description:
MLB Chipz is a basic dexterity game from Topps using themed, collectible poker chips. The components are themed poker chips with a baseball-inspired design and featuring MLB players. The chips come in several variants such as magnetic, glow-in-the-dark, and metallic but the variants do not affect game play. The game board is reminiscent of a baseball diamond, with scoring zones marked for value. The themed components do not impact game play. Each package contains four random chips, a sticker, and a game board.

Rules are included on the back of the game board for three dexterity games: Shuffle Chipz, Flip Chipz, and Spin Chipz. In all three games, the board is laid flat with the final resting position of the chip determining the score. In Shuffle Chipz, chips are slid onto the board and players have the opportunity to knock away opposing chips. In Flip Chipz, chips are flipped onto the board, and chips landing face up score double. In Spin Chipz, the chip is placed in the middle of the board and spun. The goal of the game is to accumulate the highest score within a set number of rounds.

146921.name: Secrets of the Empire: Naishou Province
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (4th Edition)
146921.description:
Subtitle: 2013 Gencon RPG, Note that the "Secrets of the Empire" titling appears on the title page, but not the cover.

User Summary: Location guide and convention adventure.

From the introduction:
Weclome to Naishou Province, our latest supplement for the Legend of the Five Rings RPG, 4th Edition. Our goal with this product is to provide GMs and players with a complete setting in which to set their adventures. Naishou Province is a single, unaligned province of the Empire, described in as much detail as possible, from its august Imperial Governor to the smallest of its villages. The contents are also designed to tie in with our upcoming product Secrets of the Empire, which focuses on factions which have received only light treatment in L5R 4th Edition up until now: the Minor Clans, Imperial samurai, ronin, and the Brotherhood of Shinsei. Although a copy of that book is not required to make use of this product, the two complement each other very easily.

From the back cover:

"There will always be a need for heroes" - Shinsei

In a forgotten corner of the Emerald Empire, the Naishou province is a hotbed of intrigue and mystery. Once called by a local poet "the province of secrets," Naishou is a minor and out-of-the-way location that has rarely if ever impacted the awareness of anyone of great importance. Even those of the Imperial families who find themselves consigned to the region are of little significance in the grand scheme of things. But obscurity is not something that comes without costs, as those who hide in the shadows of the Empire seek out such places to hatch their plots and advance their sinister agendas.

In the province of secrets, it pays to watch one's back at all times....

boardgamehonor: 2014 Origins Awards Best Historical Miniature Rules Nominee
146922.description:
Chain of Command are the revolutionary new wargames rules designed for platoon sized actions with some additional support. The rules are fast paced, exciting and fun, using the unique command and control system which presents the player with the battlefield decisions made by his historical counterpart. These are the rules Neil Shuck of Miniature Wargames described as "probably the best set of Skirmish rules I've ever played".

At 104 pages, the book includes the rules, a scenario generation system and Army Lists for Britain, Germans, the United States and Soviet Union, a system allowing the gamer to select support depending on the scenario being played, so you can pit two well matched forces against each other for a fun and challenging gaming experience.
146922.name: Chain Of Command

146923.name: Exotic Encounters: Darkmantles
146923.description:
From publisher blurb:

This particular installment of Exotic Encounters focuses on the unusual darkmantle. These stalactite-resembling magical beasts are typically fodder for 1st-level adventurers, and are notable mostly for their annoying ability to drench the area around them in darkness. The first of the new exotic darkmantles is the death’s hood darkmantle (CR 3), whose smaller size is not the liability that it initially seems, as it allows it to better conform to the faces of its victims. It attaches itself to its prey’s face and quickly strangles it, then uses the corpse like a puppet for its own nefarious ends. The equally insidious shadow weaver darkmantle (CR 5) is more powerful in areas of darkness, and is surrounded by an aura that subtly lowers the light level around it. Finally, the goliath darkmantle (CR 8) is a huge darkmantle whose favored tactic is to drop from above on unsuspecting victims, and can grapple a large number of victims at once, weakening them with its acidic drool before swallowing them whole.

146924.name: Mediterranean Fleets:  Command at Sea Volume XII
146924.description:
(from Clash of Arms website:)

Mediterranean Fleets includes over 150 ships and 90 aircraft! For the first time the Admiralty Trilogy covers the Greek, Turkish and Yugoslavian Navies. Previous listings of Italian ships and aircraft have been updated with information from many new reference sources (including Italian naval experts in Italy who were consulted and graciously shared information that resolved many questions a number of issues caused by limited English references. Fire control Gunnery accuracy and ASW capabilities especially benefitted from their assistance).

All data and information has been updated to Command at Sea 4th edition standard. More than just making the information compatible with Command at Sea, this data is now in the same format as "Harpoon" and "Fear God and Dreadnought", the other core games in the Admiralty Trilogy.

All ships and aircraft extant from 1939 to 1945, including several projected or hypothetical platforms are here; such as the projected Italian aircraft carriers, the Turkish Batiray mine laying submarine, and the Italian G.55/II Centauro fighter and the Piaggo P.108 bomber.

146925.name: Gunslingers Card Game
146925.description:
Gunslingers'' is a card game set in the wild west, where each player must build up a posse of gunslingers to fight it out to the death. The player with the last gunslinger left alive wins the game.

During the game set up procedure location cards are randomly placed to create a western town for the players to move around. Each location the players visit opens up options that they can interact with to aid them in building up a strong group of gunslingers.

Starting the game with just one gunslinger card each, the players must move around the town and reach specific locations to play action cards, hire gunslingers or buy and sell items or weapons in an effort to build up their posse and eventually shoot it out to the death.

By buying Items or weapons the players can enhance their gunslingers abilities during specific actions, such as giving a gunslinger a holster during a shoot out action will make them faster on the draw.

The action cards get the players gambling at the saloon, mining at the mine, brawling outside the sheriffs office and capturing gunslingers from the rival posses, only then marching them off to the gallows and sending the prisoner to boot hill. Many more actions cards exist that can change the strategies of the game, like the explosion card, that could blow up the train station and thus prevent the only place the players can go to hire more gunslingers, their only choice would be to wait until it was rebuilt.

As soon as one player has hired a gunslinger from the train station, the fighting can begin so you had better earn some cash fast and be that first player or you may be sent to boot hill sooner than you think........

146926.name: Spy Alley: Dice Game
146926.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In Spy Alley Dice, each player becomes a spy for their given country. Players roll the dice for a chance to guess their opponents identities. If a player rolls 3 of a kind, they may take a guess of any player as the spy that is on the three dice. If a player rolls five of a kind, they may either guess a player as any spy, or they may take a big chance and try to accomplish their mission. To accomplish their mission, the player that rolled the 5 of a kind must ask each player in a clockwise manner if they want to guess him as the spy identity on the dice. If no player is willing to make a guess and the player is the spy on the dice, that player has accomplished his mission and wins the game. Otherwise, the last player remaining in the game is the winner.

146927.name: Gen D'Armes: Rules for a Medieval Wargame
146927.description:
Late Medieval/Early Renaissance wargame rules that use a map-based simultaneous movement system to indicate where units will move each turn. A unit's status is tracked on a simple roster that records losses to the unit. Troops also have an assigned relative points value that can be used for play-balance.

Shooting resolution uses a number of six-sided dice (D6), while melee resolution uses the cumulative melee values of the stands engaged multiplied by the result of a single average die (2-3-3-4-4-5) and the totals compared. There is also shock combat resolution to take account of the impetus of charging troops.

A stand of miniatures is removed after a specific number of roster hits are recorded. The amount required varies by the type of unit; for example, peasants remove a stand for every two hits, while knights remove stands after five hits.

Gen D'Armes is a playable set of rules that has stood the test of time and uses some well thought-out mechanics. There is also a section for siege battles.

146928.name: Doctor Who DVD Board Game
146928.description:
Doctor Who Trivia Game with DVD similar to Scene It series of games.

Product Contains : 1 X DVD 1 X Doctor Who Game Board 4 X Tardis Playing Pieces 1 X Numbered Die 1 X Challenge Die 88 X Question Cards 12 X Time Travel Cards Game Rules Age 8+ 2+ Players or Teams Test Your Knowledge Against Your Companions And Save The Earth From Destructions Select Easy, Medium or Hard Questions to Play The Game.

Gameplay: Players roll die and move pieces on board, then answer questions from cards (easy, medium or hard difficulty) with aid of DVD included with game. Player who gets to end of track first, by answering the most questions correctly wins.

From Amazon:

Journey through space and time

Doctor Who 50th Anniversary DVD board game. Experience all the action with clips from the epic Dr Who TV Series! Journey through space and time with all 11 doctors and companions and confront the most fearsome monsters.

For 2+ players or teams.

Age suitability: 8 and up

From ABC:

Doctor Who 50th Anniversary DVD Board Game

Doctor Who board game 50th Anniversary

Experience all the action with clips from the epic Doctor Who TV series! Journey through space and time with all Eleven Doctors and companions – and confront the most fearsome of Monsters.

Test your knowledge against your companions and save the Earth from destruction! Select easy, medium or hard questions to play the game.

If you think you know it all then think again!

146929.name: Monopoly: Power Rangers 20th Anniversary Edition Game
146929.description: Go, Go, Power Rangers. The Power Rangers 20th Anniversary Edition of MONOPOLY allows players to buy, sell and trade iconic locations spanning the entire history including Gosei’s Command Center, The Power Chamber, Rita Repulsa’s Palace and more.

146930.description:
“Our fleet engaged the enemy in brilliant combat, protected by the Cavite and Manila forts. They obliged the enemy, with heavy loss, to maneuver repeatedly. At 9 o’clock the American Squadron took refuge behind the foreign shipping, on the east side of the bay. Our fleet, considering the enemy’s superiority, naturally suffered severe loss…. There was considerable loss of life.” –Spanish Admiral Montojo’s telegraph to Madrid during the battle.

A Brilliant Combat is the “sister” title of Death Before Dishonor: The Battle of Santiago that was the 2013 CSW Gold Level Donation reward. Like its counterpart the game uses a very simple and fun to play design that models the history well without a lot of record-keeping, and is also very solitaire play friendly. The game features the historical battle, several what-ifs, as well as scenarios that posit the Spanish Reserve Fleet sailing to take back the Philippines, or the German Asiatic Squadron challenging Admiral Dewey’s for control of the archipelago.

Each copy of A Brilliant Combat has one 11 by 17 inch map, one sheet of 77 single-sided, un-mounted counters, one players’ aide sheet and a 4 page rule book. Graphics are by Bruce Yearian. A Brilliant Combat sells for $11.95 plus shipping. Mounted counters can be had for an additional $5.00.
146930.name: A Brilliant Combat: The Battle of Manila Bay

146931.name: Move It
146931.description:
Translated from the back of the box:

Move It is an entertaining and social family game which makes your spare time efficient time.
Move It makes activity a game, and is the perfect solution to a more active way of life.
Move It is won by making a series of simple and funny physical exercises, which can be made by healthy kids and adults.
All exercises can be done indoors, and are developed in cooperation with leading experts in health and sports.

User description:
Players roll dice to move their pawn around on a field track. Passing the 100 meters, 200 meters, 300 meters or 400 meters line makes you draw a card describing a physical exercise you have to do. If you do the exercise correctly you will get a gold medal. First to 10 gold medals win the game. Medals can be lost by meeting other players pawns or the trainer.

146932.name: Disney Infinity: Toy Box Challenge
146932.description:
User Summary

Disney Infinity for the 3DS is a different style of game than the console versions. 1 to 4 players can compete against each other in a Mario Party-style boadgame match, facing off in minigames.

146933.description:
The last remnants of Humanity fight a desperate resistance against an Alien invasion that has taken over Earth. A board game for 2-7 players pits a group of up to 6 marines against an enemy player who controls the Aliens. Featuring mission based play, a modular board, a campaign based skill and equipment system, and variable enemy selection that gives a new game experience every time you play.

Players alternate turns between the Marines and the Alien commander. During a Marines turn they choose between moving, firing weapons, using skills, activating Psionic or Tech powers, and destroying nearby enemy spawn locations. In between each marines players turn the Alien Commander activates a number of his Aliens based upon they type of Spawn Points he purchased at the start of the game.

Aliens vary from the melee centric but hard hitting powerhouses of the Pharid, to the robotic utilitarian legions, and finally Alien commandos sent in to personally deal with the Marine resistance.

Marine player pick from a variety of 10 total Marine Classifications ranging from the Short range centric Assault Marine and Long range specialist the Sniper to the Drone controlling Engineer and the offensive Assault Psion.

At the end of each mission the Marines pull from a requisition deck to outfit themselves with new equipment and draw from skill decks to increase the effectiveness of their Marines. These skills and new toys have a cost, they increase the Rank value of the overall Marine and contribute to the pool of Rank Points that the Alien Commander uses to purchase Alien Spawn Points to use against the Marine on their next mission.
146933.name: The 8th Day

146934.name: Big Deal Card Games
146934.description:
A boxed set of six card games:

Bang! Zoom!

Players start with six cards each, which are used to spell words. The first person to spell BANG gets a 10 point bonus. Once this occurs, when someone spells ZOOM, they get a 10 point bonus and the game ends. Points are scored for each letter used in words. The winner is the player with the most points.

Hooey

You’ve got to be sharp. You’ve got to be shifty. Announce which cards you’re laying face down. Whether you tell the truth is up to you. Any player can then question your honesty. If they’re right - you get the pile, if they’re wrong - they do! First player to get rid of all their cards wins.

Rats!

Kid's game of pure luck. Cards are dealt face down to all players. Turn up cards in rotation and put them in the center; if you turn up a Big Fat Rat (rather than a Random Rat), you get all the cards in the center, unless the next player can also turn up a BFR. Object is to collect all the cards.

Royal Fluster

Players are dealt five cards from a modified standard deck and attempt to put together a Royal Flush by drawing and discarding cards. If you discard an Ace, you must draw a Fluster card and follow the instructions, hoping not to be harmed. The first player to make a royal flush wins the game.

Spit!

Each player deals 4 stacks with 7 down and the 8th card up. Play with only one hand (right, unless left-handed). At the same time, all players turn one card from the remaining deck face up in the center to start N piles. All may add to any pile. Ignore suits and colors. Build up or down, and change directions if you want: 5-6-7-6-7-6-7-8-9, etc. Numbers make a complete circle: 10-J-Q-K-A-2-3-4. Play only one card at a time from the top of of a stack onto a center pile; do not move cards sideways to create sequences on own stacks. Keep playing until ALL have used all their card piles.

Three Throws

This game has a theme of rock-scissors-paper. It is played in two different rounds. In the first round, players take turns turning up cards on a face-down tableau. If they turn up a set of winners, these cards are taken into hand. When all of the card possible are taken, the second round begins, which is essentially a game of war between players.

146935.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero (Apple II/C64)
146935.description:
From the back of the box:

Imagine seeing G.I. Joe come to life on your computer screen, fighting COBRA on battlefields all over the world...and you in control of their ever move. Imagine acting out "real" battles with sound effects and explosions. Imagine tracking down and destroying fully-animated COBRA enemy tanks in true-to-life action settings. Now you can do it all.

It's easy because G.I. Joe is now a Computer Activity Toy. Epyx gives you new ways to play and choices you've never had before. Start your mission by checking the computerized World Hot-Spot Map for areas of COBRA activity. Then pick the area that needs your help, and select the G.I. Joe who's best suited for the mission. The heat-loving jungle trooper Recondo is your best choice for battling Destro in the Amazon, but Wild Bill with his Assault Copter Dragonfly is your best bet if you're headed for the bush country. In all there are sixteen G.I. Joes to choose from, including the popular Duke and Stalker. No matter who you choose, you better dodge the enemy fire, pinpoint COBRA headquarters, then take aim and fire. This is your chance to become a Real American Hero, right on your own computer screen.


Select From 16 G.I. JOE Characters.
12 Different Battle Situations.
Confront Eight Different COBRA Agents in Various Challenges.
Choose Your Mission From Trouble Spots All Over the World.
Play Against an Opponent or As a Team.
Joystick Controlled.
One or Two Players.

146936.name: Pirate Rush
146936.description:
Players enlist a pirate crew trying to get the most valuable loot at the end of the game.
Pirate Rush is a role selection game for 2-4 players of about 45 minutes long.

34 treasure tiles are arranged in eight piles (the isles).
Each turn the players will select a role (wich give them different powers for the turn), get information about treasures in the map and get a loot from the island they are in.

Tiles can have positive or negative values, and a bluff, strategy and some deduction skills can make the difference between a rich pirate and a poor and doomed one.

A new resource mechanics and event has been implemented to get an even more estrategic game.

The website is in spanish, but the game isn't language dependant and english rules are available to download.
April 2015 actualization: The final rules are finally translated and reference cards are in english too)

146937.description:
1969. July 21th. The first step on the Moon. Years later, world powers try to set his hegemony on the satellite. How? With a fast a thrilling lunar race. A race game with a point of strategy, a bit of spatial visión and a lot of player interaction.

Players try to make long and fast jumps with his astronauts while collecting the stars and avoid falling on clasm, crashing with mountains or just be trampled by the oders.

Each turn the players while take four of the 6 special movement dices and will program up to three jumps for the turn. If things go fine they'll advance along the way to victory, otherwise...

For the race they count on the help of their own Earth Control teams, which give them options as re-roll dices or throw more than four movement dice.

English rules can be found on the site and the game is not language dependant.
146937.name: Walking on the Moon

146938.name: Minus Pocus
146938.description:
The world mightiest magic schools face to prove themselves. The better students will fight between fireballs, ciclopean walls and terrific bunnies. A fast game for all ages of frenzied and mathematical fun.

Three spell cards are show between both players at every moment. They show a number (from 1 to 80) and various magical effects.

The players take ingredient cards from a common deck, containing numbers and operations and try to throw the spells by getting the exact number on it, making sums, subtractions and other operations with their ingredients. The game is won when a player knock out all the mages on the opposing team.

Website is in spanish but you can download the english rules inside. The game is not language dependant.

146939.name: Whitehack
146939.description:
Publisher blurb:

Whitehack is a complete mainstream fantasy role-playing game in only 32 pages. It owes a lot to the Old School Renaissance movement, especially to the previous work of Marv Breig and Matthew J. Finch, but it is a hybrid of old and new rather than a retro-clone. Whitehack features


0e roots
Three (new) classes
Two d20s and three d6s needed to play
A group system that deals with character species, vocations and affiliations
Unified saving throws
Task rolls and auctions for longer contests
Magic system based on vocations, miracle wordings and hit point costs
Combat system with full rules for the use of grids and miniatures—but you can play without too!
New rules for death and healing
Referee section with advice on play style, campaigns and adventures
More than 80 monsters
Advice on magic artifacts, with a few fleshed out examples
An example campaign
Two introductory adventures
Character sheet
Eight example characters
A hundred fantasy names
32 saddle-stitched pages in trade size (6 x 9 inches).

146941.name: Zombify: Dead City
146941.description:
Africa was first to disapear when unknown virus hits there as epicentrum. But it was only a few days before Asia and Europe to fall. US try to fight as efficient as they can - closed borders, no ship or plane can land... but it just wasn't enough.

On the last, seperated city few survivers trying to hold on in the shelter of old town center, but lack of supplies and problems that appears force them to move outside risking thier lives and trying to make a contact and call for rescue...

In Zombify: Dead City, the players take the role of survivers in the city full of zombies - their every move and every action can bring more zombies on board and they just have to survive till the rescue comes... but who will be rescue?

During their turns players can explore the city in the search for supplies, special items or solve problems that affects gameplay. They are using custom dice to fight and solve actions. After few days they can call for rescue and if they defend their shelter - they will be extracted and wins.

146942.name: Tricilve - Lojalisternas tid
146942.description:
Back of the book (in Swedish):

Tricilve - Lojalisternas tid är den andra officiella modulen till rollspelet Svavelvinter. Det trakoriska rikets huvudstad Tricilve har alltid utgjort en arena präglad av gudinnan Kastykes devis att gudarna älskar den som är framgångsrik. Hårdast är konkurrensen i stadens slum där kampen mellan ligor som Perukmakarna, Hundätarna och Flagellanterna hittills har förts i skuggorna. Nu har den plötsligt lyfts ut på den stora storpolitiska scenen.


Modulen beskriver ingående Tricilves värsta slumområden med personer, platser och händelser som kretsar kring Perukmakarna och dess ledare Ingolmo Dokella.
Allt som behövs för att spela kampanjspel i denna oroliga tid i huvudstaden ingår, inklusive ett skuggspelsbräde och elva färdiga skuggmakter att välja bland.
Boken innehåller även det kompletta äventyret I perukmakarnas hemliga tjänst, där karaktärerna dras in i intrigerna runt Ingolmo Dokella som kräver hämnd för sin broders död...
Denna modul är till större delen skriven av Erik Granström själv och utspelas mellan hans romaner Slaktare små och den kommande Vredesverk i sviten om den femte konfluxen.


User translation:

Tricilve - Lojalisternas tid (Time of loyalists) is the second official module for Svavelvinter the role-playing game. Tricilve, the capital of the Trakorian realm, has always been an arena characterized by the goddess Kastyke's motto that the gods love the ones whom are successful. The hardest is the competition in the city's slum where the battle between gangs such as the Wigmakers, the Dog-eaters and the Flagellants have to date been raged in the shadows. Now, suddenly, it has been brought out to the great political scene.


The module thoroughly describes the worst slum areas of Tricilve with persons, places and events related to the Wigmakers and their leader Ingolmo Dokella.
Everything that is needed for campaign play in this unruly time in the city is included, also a shadow play board and eleven pre-made shadow powers to choose from.
Included in the book is also the complete adventure In the Wigmakers Secret Service, where the characters are pulled into the intrigues around Ingolmo Dokella who wants revenge for his brother's death...
This module is mainly written by Erik Granström himself and is set between his novels Slaktare små and the upcoming Vredsverk in the suite about the fifth konflux.

146943.name: Warlock
146943.description:
A curse is cast on you, which transports you to the magical land of Norkobia. You wish to return to your earthly existence, but Lord Maldorf, ruler of Norkobia, will not let you go unless you meet his demands and build him an enormous empire.

In Warlock, you must use the skills and powers of mythical creatures such as giants, wizards and gnomes to build your empire and thwart your opponents. Each card offers four possibilities, and by using your cards strategically, you can build the biggest empire, be released to return home, and win the game.

The aim of the game is to build an empire next to your castle, with cards that are laid out in a 4x4 grid. Every turn, players will receive 5 cards. One will be placed in their dungeon (where a card will receive a special ability), another one in Hubba's bar, where all the local creatures gather to be hired by the players. The other three cards are kept in the players' hands. The round continues with an auction where players can use their cards to purchase others. Once the auction is done, players can use their cards' special abilities to expand their empire and thus score points. Beware however of other players, as they can steal some of your cards, or destroy parts of your empire. The game calls for cunning placement of your cards in your empire and shrewd bidding in the auction phase. The game ands after three full rounds, or after a player manages to build his/her 16th city (card) in his/her empire. Points are awarded based on the value of your cities, majority bonuses and the variation of the cities built in your empire.

146944.name: Reboot, Recharge, Recycle
146944.description:
Publisher blurb:

Reboot, Recharge, Recycle - an introductory micro-module designed to be used as an in-store demo game. This micromod features fully fleshed-out PRs with descriptions of their Features and Defects, a simple plot, and several situations designed to ease new players into the Engine Heart system!

146945.name: Industry Standard
146945.description:
User summary:

A mini-module for 2-5 robots, unlocked during the Engine Heart Kickstarter in 2013.

146946.name: In Transit
146946.description:
User summary:

A mini-module for 2-5 robots, unlocked during the Engine Heart Kickstarter in 2013.

146947.name: Consumer Grade
146947.description:
User summary:

A mini-module for 2-5 robots, unlocked during the Engine Heart Kickstarter in 2013.

146948.name: The World Above
146948.description:
User summary:

A mini-module for 2-5 robots, unlocked during the Engine Heart Kickstarter in 2013.

146949.name: Power and Light
146949.description:
Back of the book:

Out of the factory and into the streets! This 80-page module is packed full of new locations, new robots, new features and defects, and new ideas for the Programmer to make the players work for their power! A copy of the Engine Heart rulebook is required to play.

146950.name: Roolipelaaja (Issue 15 - May 2008)
146950.description:
The theme of this issue is apocalypse and end of the world. Suitably with the theme it features long epitaph for Gary Gygax.

This issue also a microsized indie game about the band Teräsbetoni, who represented Finland in Eurovision song contest at the same time as the issue was published.

146951.name: Freedom Force vs. the 3rd Reich: Bronze Age Bonus Disk
146951.description:
From the readme.txt on the CD:

Freedom Force vs the 3rd Reich Bonus CD
Welcome to the Freedom Force vs the 3rd Reich Bonus CD. This CD contains bonus characters that you can use in game as well as a selection of concept art and wallpapers.

Bonus Characters
The bonus characters are 70s versions of classic Freedom Force characters: El Diablo, Eve and the Bullet!

146952.name: Expedition: Famous Explorers Promo Card – Christopher Columbus
146952.description:
This is a promo card for Expedition: Famous Explorers given out at Gen Con 2013

Card Text: Take this card. Score 2 points immediately. At the end of the game score 1 additional point for each colored arrow's Expedition (for a maximum of 3 points) that ends at a named location within the Americas (any Blue or Green Expedition location).

146953.name: Powerhouses of Wrestling!
146953.description:
Powerhouses of Wresting! is a two-player dice game. Players take turns rolling five dice to get matching numbers (with 1s and 2s matching each other and 6s being wild). After each roll a player can decide to stop or re-roll unmatched dice, with a failure on the new roll costing a matching die.

There are a few additional rules, e.g. getting all the dice to match allows a player to go "over the top" and start over with more dice.

The rules were originally printed and distributed as "shareware." They are currently available online.

146954.name: Space Force Captains
146954.description:
From the back of the box

ENEMY FLEET AHEAD !

Now it's your turn to discover, explore and conquer an entire universe. But it won't be easy: the unique mix of turn-based strategy and role-playing will be extremely challenging! Choose from more than 100 Captains and upgrade your ships in almost unlimited ways. Lead your customized squadrons into the fight with 6 distinct species and conquer solar system after solar system...

146955.name: Gangsters 2: Vendetta
146955.description:
The game is very heavily a strategy game, utilizing a point and click interface. Each gangster ('hood') the player controls can have four subordinates that will help the character in a firefight. Players can use vehicles to reach targets faster, attempt drive-bys and transport goods. Weapons can be upgraded, including those of your 'hoods'. Business must be bought, sold and taken over from rival gangs, players must set up many types of illegal businesses to make the most money e.g. gambling dens, breweries and brothels.

The player is given objectives to fulfill. They range from setting up illegal businesses, claiming the enemies' business, kidnapping, and murder.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gangsters 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

146956.name: Lords of Everquest
146956.description:
User Summary

Lords of EverQuest (LOEQ) is a 3D fantasy Real-Time Strategy game released in December 2003. It was developed by the short-lived startup company Rapid Eye Entertainment and published by Sony Online Entertainment (SOE). SOE distributes Lords of EverQuest currently.

Unlike the original EverQuest, Lords of EverQuest is fundamentally a single player game, and after the initial payment for the software, does not require a recurring monthly fee in order to play.

146957.name: Clashing Blades!
146957.description:
Clashing Blades! is a two-player card game representing a fencing match, played with a standard 52-card deck. The heart cards are used to represent damage and the ace-10 of the other suits are used to play. In each round, players start by simultaneously choosing cards, with play passing to the player threatened with damage after that. Spades are used for attack, diamonds for defense, and clubs for parries and ripostes.

Advanced rules add uses for the extra heart cards (extra-powerful attacks) and face and joker cards (events).

The game was originally released as a printed set of rules in a "shareware" version. A second edition with custom cards is forthcoming from Popcorn Press.

146958.name: Start-Up 2000
146958.description:
Start-Up (also known as Start-Up 2000) is a PC video game in which players must try to build a successful business start-up from venture capitalists to IPO's. Start-Up is published by Monte Cristo and distributed by Electronic Arts.

Source: Wikipedia, "Start-Up", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

146961.name: SCRIOS: A Tabletop 3D Space Combat RPG
146961.description:
From the Author:

In SCRIOS, players assume the roles of single-seat space craft pilots. Leveraging modern tablets and 3D-print-on-demand for custom game pieces helps create a unique tabletop game perspective. SCRIOS still reaches for an old-school RPG feel–no special equipment beyond a paper, pencil, and polyhedral dice are needed to enjoy–in fact, anyone who’s played RPGs likely would never have to buy anything new to play. Even the core rulebook is distributed for free. The game focuses on simple to follow rules in what is a traditionally complex genre–ultimately, anyone who has played a traditional RPG should be able to sit down with a single sheet of quickstart rules and feel comfortable playing.

The rule book is intended to be a living document, providing regular updates as new content is released, including additional space ships, equipment, character skills and design options, and tools for game masters ("Space Marshals"). The iBooks edition includes an interactive character sheet, and introductory mission, Trouble in Tango.

146962.name: uKloo
146962.description:
uKloo is an educational "Early Reader Treasure Hunt" game to help teach young children reading basics. It is designed to help reluctant readers and is designed for younger ages (4+).

The goal of the game is to successfully navigate through a series of hidden clue cards to win a surprise.

In uKloo, an adult puts the 'picture helper' poster on the fridge, a door, or a wall and hides a selection of clue cards around the house based on reading level and game length in such a way that the clue cards will form a chain. The last clue is given to the players to begin the game.

For competitive mode, two or more chains of clues need to be created to see which child will finish first.

uKloo has been awarded Creative Child Magazine 2011 Game of the Year and is a Dr. Toy 10 Best Active Products and 100 Best Children's Products winner.

The game box includes 42 clue cards with 3 colour-coded levels of achievement, a "Picture Helper" reference poster, 12 blank "Surprise" cards, and information about the creation of the game and future releases.

146963.description:
Swim, spawn, and eat shrimp while avoiding sharks! In Let Them Eat Shrimp!, players place fish tiles (in various geometric shapes) in an effort to spawn (by covering fish eggs on the board) and receive more fish tiles. The fish can also eat shrimp (to gain victory points) and must avoid sharks (which will eat your fish, fish eggs, and shrimp).

Let Them Eat Shrimp! has two ways to play. The beginner's game is suitable for younger players, while the advanced version adds more strategy and depth, as well as more danger; in this version of the game, players might be knocked out early if they can't spawn quickly enough or if their eggs are devoured by the roaming sharks. The game also includes multiple game board components, which can be mixed and match for variety and various skill levels.
146963.name: Let Them Eat Shrimp!
boardgameexpansion: Let Them Eat Shrimp: Shark v. Squid Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: RDTN Episode 59 – Come Sail Away: XCOM, Harbour, Let Them Eat Shrimp, Wizard Dodgeball, and Contest again
The Long View: Biblios

146964.description:
Disclaimer: This is an unofficial, unauthorized, non-profit, fan-made game and is in NO WAY associated with The Topps Company Inc., Catalyst Game Labs, Piranha Games, or Harebrained Schemes. It is a pure labor of love! Battletech, ‘Mech, and MechWarrior are registered trademarks of the The Topps Company, Inc. I do not claim any credit for the artwork used in the game. All fan artwork used with permission of the artists. Screenshots obtained from MechWarrior Online, developed and published by Piranha Games.


BATTLETECH: DOMINATION is a deck-building card game for 2 players set in the BattleTech/MechWarrior universe. Both players start with a small deck of weak cards and strive to build a deck that dominates their opponent with an army of powerful BattleMechs, combat vehicles, infantry, and advanced technology. Support, Resource, and Attack cards also generate powerful effects to help you achieve dominance on the battlefield. At the end of the game, the players score points for each LosTech card in their deck while subtracting points for any Overrun cards in their deck.

BTD v4.1 is the the current version of the game as of 12/10/2016 and contains a total of 205 cards.

146969.name: Nanashi no Game
146969.description:
User Summary

You are cursed to die after playing a haunted video game, and are attacked by the ghosts of those the game killed in the past. You hold the DS like a book and interact with the world and move with the D-Pad and touch screen. There are parts of the game where you play the cursed game, on a device very similar to a DS, when you do you play a game with a similar style to the first Final Fantasy. You do not fight enemies in the game or real world setting, gameplay is limited because you also do not keep an inventory in either world.

146971.name: Nanashi no Game Me
146971.description:
User Summary

The sequel to Nanashi no Game, a game where you play as people who have been cursed to die by a video game that is similar to the old Final Fantasy games. Improves on the original by improving the controls, having larger levels, increasing the amount of interaction, and having different paths and endings. In addition to playing the cursed RPG you can also find and play levels of a cursed platformer.

146972.description:
It is the year 562, the Age of the Diaspora. Humanity, established in hundreds of worlds throughout the known universe, is fighting for survival against cruel alien races, and even against each other as confronted by disputes that appear increasingly absurd.

One world after another is engulfed by the fury of the war while the contenders are fighting ruthlessly to prevent Total Extinction.

Total Extinction is a futuristic wargame with miniatures of 28mm for 2 or more players.

Players take command of a battalion of troops from one of the Star Nations (Glorlon, Union of Colonies, Regulatory Corporation, Elohim, Skraldar or Theocracy) facing a relentless war for survival. Each battalion is divided into units consisting of between 1 and 9 miniatures and led by a commander.

The game is divided into a series of turns (typically up to 6) which can be solved in about 2 hours. On each turn, alternately, players are activating their units that can move, shoot and even assault enemy units to take control of key areas of the battlefield (Objectives) and win the game. To achieve the victory, the armies also have the help of their commanders, who, by skillful tactics (represented by cards), can provide better techniques to attain their goals.
146972.name: Total Extinction

146973.name: Astra Super Stars
146973.description:
User Summary

A 2D fighting game where all of your characters are fighting in mid-air. You are able to fly upwards or downwards before being returned to center screen and are able to knock opponents through the air with your attacks.

The Saturn version requires a 4MB Ram cart.

146974.name: Tunse'al GM Screen
146974.description:
'User summary:

A laminated, double-sided, color GM Screen containing a small map, a monster table, some hints on improvisation and combat tables. Two panels.

146975.name: Bushi Seiryuden: Futari no Yusha
146975.description:
User Summary

Take control of a swordsman trying to rescue his sister from monsters. The game changes perspective depending on what you are doing exploration is top down, it becomes first person when you speak to someone, and it becomes a sidescroller when in battle. You are joined by a small creature that you control at the same time as your character, she is able to lift you or to distract or attack enemies but she has her own life bar.

146976.name: Power Blazer
146976.description:
User Summary

A 2D sidescroller where you play as a robot armed with a boomerang. You are able to select what stage you want to go to, like Mega Man, but the only power ups you get are found in the levels and not by defeating bosses.

146977.name: HeroClix: Man of Steel 2 Player Mini-Game
146977.description:
The HeroClix Man of Steel Mini-Game is thematically based on the Movie, Man of Steel. The game is at its core a face off between Superman and General Zod. These characters each lead their own faction of fighters into battle in a struggle over the fate of Earth. Each of the two characters and factions are unique and present a different tactical approach to the game.

The game-play operates under normal HeroClix rules which must be accessed at HeroClix.com. In its barest form the game operates through a set of abilities possessed by each character such as movement, attack, defense, etc. A certain number of actions can be assigned per turn to use these abilities. There are several strategies in this game but only one way to win: eliminate all of the opponents characters from the board. The path to this ultimate goal rests on a player's ability to successfully maneuver around the playing field and utilize the special super powers of General Zod and Superman.

Includes:
1 Superman #101 miniature
1 General Zod #106 miniature
2 Character cards
1 Full Color Game Board
2 Dice (Six Sided)
32 Tokens(Two factions)

146978.name: Shadow Force
146978.description:
User Summary

A beat em up game for one or two players. Unlike most fighters, the game uses six buttons to attack two for your characters weapons or punches and two kicks giving you access to many more moves than most beat em up games. There is also a jump button and a button that possesses an enemy character that you can then control and do different special attacks with. After beating each level you are able to choose an enemy to play as, you will then fight in a one on one battle against a computer, for bonus points, or the second player where the loser loses a credit.

The Japanese version only has three buttons and removes the fighting sections after each level but it adds unique endings for finishing the game with different pairings of its four characters.

146979.name: Triple Triplo
146979.description:
Each player has 3 pawns of the same color. The first player to group together all 3 of his/her pawns is the winner.

Players first play turns in which they place their pawns on the board; each pawn of a single player has to be on a differently colored board space. Players then in turn move one of their 3 pawns.

There's also single a 'neutral piece' that all players get to move once during their turn.

146980.name: Roolipelaaja (Issue 16 - Jul 2008)
146980.description: The theme of this issue is communism, how to design scenarios based on Soviet Union and the communist revolution of Russia in the 1917. The issue also deals with communism as part of world setting idea in a more general level.

146981.description:

"Vier Waisenkinder in den Hügeln" set in 1920s Dunwich

146985.name: Battalion Commander (Web Browser)
146985.description:
User Summary

An upgrade heavy shooter. Play as a battalion commander who shoots constantly against enemies and frees allies from cages as he goes. Each ally joins your team to increase its size and potency. After each game your rank increases which allows you to keep a larger battalion and gives your main character larger hp. You can also spend money earned in the level to buy upgrades which give you a number of bonuses such as changing your starting weapon, improving starting weapons, giving you allies from the beginning of a level and unlocking new and more powerful allies.

146986.name: Combat Mission: Market Garden
146986.description:
Combat Mission: Market Garden depicts allied Field Marshall Bernard Montgomery's September 1944 dash across Holland in a daring gambit to leap the Rhine river and enter the heartland of Germany itself. Fielding U.S., British and Polish forces, Operation Market Garden was meant to be the lightning stroke which would end the war that year. It included the largest airborne operation seen to that day or since. Market Garden ended in tragedy, though, when the allies failed to capture their final objective, the Rhine river bridge at Arnhem. It was, in the famous words of Lt. General Fredrick "Boy" Browning, a bridge too far.

CM: Market Garden allows the player to recreate Monty's desperate struggles to reach and cross the Rhine in Holland. It is an expansion module to Combat Mission: Battle for Normandy and requires the base game in order to play, upgraded to 2.0! No other modules are required.

Source: The Developer Website.

146987.name: Mothership
146987.description:
From the inlay:

The evil Mothership, lurking in deep space, is preparing to take over your beloved planet. She has launched an all-out attack. Waves of drone fighters come tearing down the Zarway like crazed lemmings. You and you Starfighter must dodge the drone fighters, destroy them, and then attack the Mothership. But watch out! She's got laser cannons too!

User Summary:

Mothership is an early game for the ZX81 with surprisingly deep gameplay. As well as moving your ship left and right to avoid and shoot at enemy craft, you can also move up and down in height. You have to be at the same altitude as enemies to shoot at them or for them to hit your ship. Shooting aliens at a higher altitude scores more points, but flying at a higher altitude also makes your craft move faster, making the game more challenging.

There is a selection of three levels. In the first, enemies try to crash into your ship, but do not shoot, in the second, they do not crash into you, but can shoot, in the third, enemies both attempt to crash into you and shoot.

Credits:

By Andrew Laity

146989.name: Knight Line
146989.description:
Knight Line is a minimalist connection game for two players.

Each player has 24 square tiles in their colour; at the start of the game, these tiles are placed in two adjacent stacks, one of each colour.

A move consists of moving part of a stack (at least one tile must be left behind) to an empty space by making a knight's move. All pieces must be connected at least diagonally throughout the game.

The first player to make a line of 4, orthogonally or diagonally, wins.

To offset the first player advantage, they must move only a single piece on their first move.

146990.name: QS Scramble
146990.description:
From the inlay:

You are flying over the surface of a distant planet under attack from aliens and your fuel is running out. You thrust upwards blasting aliens from the sky and downwards bombing fuel dumps and ground bound ships. A landscape of mountains, plateaus and valleys (randomly produced) slides under your ship as waves of aliens descend from above and rockets fire up at you from the ground.

User summary:

This game is loosely based on the arcade classic "Scramble", though with a randomly generated landscape.

Like many Quicksilva games for the ZX81, the game is provided with a list of POKEs which can be used to modify parameters such as the number of enemy ships on-screen, points per fuel dump destroyed, etc.

The game can take advantage of either or both of two Quicksilva peripherals. A QS Character Board was a peripheral which allowed alternative characters in place of the ZX81s standard character set. These could then be used to display alternative shapes as graphics rather than using letters, numbers and simple blocks to make up the display. The other was the QS Sound Board. The standard ZX81 had no sound output, the QS Sound Board provided audio output for the game.

The outside of the inlay states "For the ZX-81 with 16K RAM" however the instructions state that the basic game requires a minimum of only 4K RAM.

146991.name: QS Defenda
146991.description:
From the inlay:

A grotesque alien craft rises from the pink glow of the horizon, firing a salvo of Meson torpedoes at you. You thrust forward swooping over the surface firing your ruby laser, with a blossoming of flame and metal fragments the first alien is destroyed.

A second wave of alien ships drop at you from space ... Your fingers tighten on the controls...

User summary:

This is very loosely based on the arcade classic "Defender". The differences include that you can only go from left to right, and that you are not actually defending humans on the planet surface below. You control your ship with up and down, thrust forward and fire.

146992.name: Golden Pyramids
146992.description:
Golden Pyramids is a boardgame in which players go exploring an ancient pyramid in search of treasure.

The inside of the pyramid is explored as the players go adventuring from room to room. Players will have to find their way around by placing ladders, moving mummies around, collecting keys and opening doors.

At times, all players will need to cooperate in order to get deeper into the pyramid. But when there's treasure in sight, it's every adventurer for him or herself!

Each player has two explorers with which to search through the pyramid. The main goal is of course the Kings Chamber and the treasure within it. Be warned though: the moment the Kings Chamber is discovered, the spirit of the Pharaoh will descend from the heavens in order to keep the explorers from escaping with his riches. Now the race for the exit is on as all that are still inside the pyramid will be trapped forever once the Pharaoh's spirit seals the pyramid shut!

146993.name: Simutek Package Seven
146993.description:
Publisher's Catalog

Package Seven Includes:

Backgammon 5.0 -- 2 different skill levels make this game a challenge to average or advanced players. FAST (15 second avg) Looks for best possible move to beat you! FANTASTIC GRAPHICS. Plays doubles and uses international rules

Speed Reading -- Increases your reading speed. Also checks for comprehension of material. Great for teenagers and adults to improve reading skills

PT 109 -- Drop depth charges on moving subs. Lower depths get higher points in this fast action graphics game.

Yahtzee -- Play Yahtzee with the computer. This popular game is even more fun and challenging against a TRS-80!

Wall Street -- Can you turn your $50,000 into a million dollars? That's the object of this great game. Simulates an
actual stock market!

146994.name: Quiddler Junior
146994.description:
Quiddler Junior is a card game in which players try to score the most points possible by creating words from the letters in their hand.

The game lasts six rounds, with players receiving 2-7 letter cards each round: two the first round, three the second, etc. Players play simultaneously, drawing and discarding one card at a time until a player can use all of his letters to create a word and go out. Each other player draws and discards one final time, then creates the most valuable word possible. Players score points for the value of their word, and the player with the longest word each round scores 5 bonus points. (Some cards have more than one letter on them, allowing for words that have more letters than the number of cards.)

Whoever has the most points after six rounds wins!

146995.name: Monster Invasion
146995.description:
Publisher's Catalog

Monster Invasion with fantastic sound effects

Don't waste your quarters at the arcades ever again. This "super fast" machine language program is the finest invaders game for the TRS-80 ever made! Comes with sensational sound effects!

Order This Classic Today!

Only $19.95

Cat. #67666 16K PMC-80, TRS-80 Model I or III.

P.S. The animation is so good, the illustrations don't do it justice!

146996.name: El Juego de la Cultura
146996.description:
Trivia game in which the players have to answer questions about occidental culture: History, Literature, Art, Music, Philosophy and Science.

El Juego de la Cultura (The Game of Culture) contains a board, six pawns, a die and 600 cards with questions, answers and explanations. The boardgame is sold together with the book "La cultura: todo lo que hay que saber" (The Culture: Everything you need to know or Bildung: Alles was man wissen muß in the original Edition in German) by Dietrich Schwanitz. The original edition of both the game and the book is German.

This is a very simple and old-fashioned "Roll&Move" trivia game.

The players roll the die, move the pawn and answer questions about occidental culture. The topic (History, Literature, Art, Music, Philosophy and Science) is determined by the color of the space that the pawn has moved on. The player has to choose between three possible answers. For example:
- Who is the author of "The portrait of Dorian Gray": (A) William Faulkner, (B) Charles Dickens or (C) Oscar Wilde.

The answer to the question can be found in the back of the card. There are a few spaces in the track with special rules, such as the player loses a turn (jail) or go back to Start (sarcophagus).

The first player that reaches the end of the track and responds correctly a question on a topic chosen by the other players wins.

The answer to all the questions can be also found in the accompanying book "La cultura: todo lo que hay que saber" (The Culture: Everything you need to know or Bildung: Alles was man wissen muß in the original Edition in German) by Dietrich Schwanitz.

146997.name: Five Crowns Junior
146997.description:
In Five Crowns Junior, players try to match all five cards in their hand by color or suit. The first player to do so gains a treasure chest, and the player with the most chests wins.

The game lasts five rounds, and one of the suits is wild each round. Each player starts with a hand of five cards, and players play simultaneously, drawing and discarding one card until someone is able to go out. Once a player does so, each other player has one final turn; for each card that a player can't match, she receives a packrat chip. If players tie for treasure chests after five rounds, the player with the fewest packrat chips wins.

146998.name: Hungry Ghosts
146998.description:
User Summary

You are a warrior who has taken many lives and now finds him/herself in the afterlife. You are destined to wonder hell like the souls of the ones you killed but you have the ability to change your fate. You must go to the Gates of Judgement where you will either be sent to an eternity of hell or reborn as a human. The game is played in first person. Physical damage can be taken from your vitality while non physical attacks deplete your spirit. Combat is handles by drawing your weapon and then moving the right stick in different directions depending on what kind of weapon you have equipped.

146999.name: Katapult
146999.description:
Katapult is a game of skill and strategy where players have to bounce their balls accurately in the rooms of the castle to control the largest possible number and respond to attacks of their opponents.

Integrate kings your game to increase the difficulty of the game.

On each of your turn, you bounce a ball on your "trampoline" to send it in one of the 16 "rooms" in the castle. You win points by controlling (majority of balls) those rooms in certain combination (3 or 4 in a row, or the 4 center rooms) at the end of the round (when everyone has no more balls to throw). The game ends after a couple of rounds totalling the points from each round and highest score wins.
